analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos zer ba / dus gang gi tshe thos //
translated: They asked, What is this 'Thus have I heard'?🔽 When was it heard?

original: ston pa gang la thos //
analyzed: ston pa gang la thos //
translated: To whom was it heard?

original: gnas gang du thos /🔽'khor gang dang lhan cig tu thos /
analyzed: gnas gang du thos / 'khor gang dang lhan cig tu thos /
translated: Where was it heard?🔽 With what retinue was it heard?

original: brjod bya phun sum tshogs pa gang la thos /
analyzed: brjod bya phun sum tshogs pa gang la thos /
translated: What is the perfect subject matter that was heard?

original: @247b brjod ces dris so //
analyzed: @247b brjod ces dris so //
translated: Thus, they asked.

original: de'i lan du gleng gzhi byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i lan du gleng gzhi byung ngo //
translated: The nidana is the answer to that.

original: da ni tshig gi don bshad de /🔽'di skad ces pa ni nges par byas nas rang dang gzhan rjes su mthun pa'i shes pas /
analyzed: da ni tshig gi don bshad de / 'di skad ces pa ni nges par byas nas rang dang gzhan rjes su mthun pa'i shes pas /
translated: Now, the meaning of the words will be explained.

original: nges par bzung ba'i rgyud kyi don ma lus par nges par ston pa la /
analyzed: nges par bzung ba'i rgyud kyi don ma lus par nges par ston pa la /
translated: Since it is said, Thus, it is ascertained that the meaning of the tantra that is ascertained by one's own and others' concordant understanding is fully taught without exception.

original: gcig tu nges par byas nas phyin ci ma log par smra ba'o //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par byas nas phyin ci ma log par smra ba'o //
translated: Having ascertained it as one, one speaks without error.

original: bdag gis thos zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag gis thos zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for “I have heard,”

original: bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du thos pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du thos pa ste /
translated: it is that which was heard directly by myself.

original: bcom ldan 'das las bdag nyid kyis ming dang don dang gzhung 'di dag thos kyi bdag gis rang dgar byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las bdag nyid kyis ming dang don dang gzhung 'di dag thos kyi bdag gis rang dgar byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: I have heard these names, meanings, and texts directly from the Bhagavān, and I have not fabricated them on my own.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa kho na ltar bsdus pa yin par shes so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa kho na ltar bsdus pa yin par shes so //
translated: I have compiled them just as the Bhagavān taught.

original: de ltar shes pas shugs la rang dgar byas la bkag go //
analyzed: de ltar shes pas shugs la rang dgar byas la bkag go //
translated: By knowing it in that way, I implicitly refute those who fabricate on their own.

original: de ltar bsdus nas 'dug pas bsgrubs na 'bras bu yang 'byung la //
analyzed: de ltar bsdus nas 'dug pas bsgrubs na 'bras bu yang 'byung la //
translated: If one practices by compiling it in that way and remaining in that state, the result will also arise.

original: dngos po'i gnas lugs kyang ston par shes nas gang zag rnams 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i gnas lugs kyang ston par shes nas gang zag rnams 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Knowing that the reality of things is taught, people will engage it.

original: yang na bdag gis thos zhes pas //
analyzed: yang na bdag gis thos zhes pas //
translated: Or, as for “I have heard,”

original: bdag rang gi mos pa'i dbang gis thos kyi /
analyzed: bdag rang gi mos pa'i dbang gis thos kyi /
translated: I heard it through the power of my own interest.

original: gzhan gyis ni gzhung gzhan du yang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni gzhung gzhan du yang yin te /
translated: Others heard it in other texts.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'khor bstan pas so //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'khor bstan pas so //
translated: This is because the retinue is taught in the explanation that will come.

original: 'di ni gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcod pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcod pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: This excludes the possibility that it is something else that is possessed.

original: slob dpon ma khol gyis kyang //
analyzed: slob dpon ma khol gyis kyang //
translated: Ācārya Maṇḍanavṛddhi also says:

original: gsung gcig gis kyang bstan mod kyang //
analyzed: gsung gcig gis kyang bstan mod kyang //
translated: Even though it is taught by a single utterance,

original: du ma nyid du rtogs mdzad par //🔽bdag la nye bar ston no zhes //
analyzed: du ma nyid du rtogs mdzad par // bdag la nye bar ston no zhes //
translated: it is understood as manifold.

original: skye bo kun gyis shes par 'gyur //
analyzed: skye bo kun gyis shes par 'gyur //
translated: Thus, all people know

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: that it is taught to me.

original: bcom ldan 'das la gsung gi che ba mang po yod par bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gsung gi che ba mang po yod par bstan te /
translated: This shows that the Bhagavān has many great qualities of speech.

original: gsung gcig la yang du mar snang ba'o //
analyzed: gsung gcig la yang du mar snang ba'o //
translated: Even a single utterance appears as manifold.

original: yang na bdag gis thos zhes pa //🔽'chad par 'gyur ba'i bcom ldan 'das las /
analyzed: yang na bdag gis thos zhes pa // 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bcom ldan 'das las /
translated: Or, “I heard” means

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug la sogs pa las gcig nas gcig tu brgyud nas thos pa yang ma yin te /🔽dngos su bcom ldan 'das las phyag na rdo rje nyid kyis thos zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug la sogs pa las gcig nas gcig tu brgyud nas thos pa yang ma yin te / dngos su bcom ldan 'das las phyag na rdo rje nyid kyis thos zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: that it was not heard from one to another, such as Lokeśvara,🔽but that it was heard directly from the Bhagavān himself.

original: de ltar shes pas shugs las brgyud nas thos pa bkag go //
analyzed: de ltar shes pas shugs las brgyud nas thos pa bkag go //
translated: Thus, it is understood that it was heard by Vajrapāṇi himself from the Bhagavān.🔽By understanding it in this way, it indirectly refutes that it was heard from one to another.

original: thos pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for “heard,”

original: bdag nyid nyan pa'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' nyid du bstan la sdud pa'i dus nas sangs rgyas nyid yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid nyan pa'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' nyid du bstan la sdud pa'i dus nas sangs rgyas nyid yin no //
translated: When he was a listener, he was a bodhisattva; when he was a compiler, he was a buddha.

original: 'di ni bzlas nas bstan pas shin tu yang tshad ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bzlas nas bstan pas shin tu yang tshad ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is a very reliable testimony, since it is a repetition.

original: mngon sum du thos pa la yang 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon sum du thos pa la yang 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: This is how one should understand the direct hearing.

original: slob dpon med par 'di'i bya ba @248a * //
analyzed: slob dpon med par 'di'i bya ba @248a * //
translated: Without a teacher, one should not perform the actions of this tantra.

original: mi bya'o zhes yang dag par gsungs par shes par bya'o //🔽de ltar bstan nas gang gi tshe //
analyzed: mi bya'o zhes yang dag par gsungs par shes par bya'o // de ltar bstan nas gang gi tshe //
translated: This is the correct teaching that should be understood.

original: gang las gang du gang dang lhan cig thos pa de dang / de'i rim pa bzhin bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang las gang du gang dang lhan cig thos pa de dang / de'i rim pa bzhin bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Having taught this, in order to teach in the same order as he heard it,

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba bstan te /
translated: he said, at one time.

original: 'di shin tu dkon pa nyid dang / bdag nyid mang du thos pa nyid du sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'di shin tu dkon pa nyid dang / bdag nyid mang du thos pa nyid du sgrub par byed do //
translated: This establishes that it is very rare and that he himself is very learned.

original: yang na dus gcig na zhes pa chos dang sbyar na /
analyzed: yang na dus gcig na zhes pa chos dang sbyar na /
translated: At one time can also be applied to the Dharma.

original: dus gcig gi tshe na bdag gis 'di thos byas nas /
analyzed: dus gcig gi tshe na bdag gis 'di thos byas nas /
translated: At one time, I heard this.

original: 'di lta bu'i phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo mtshar che ba'i chos ni dus gzhan gyi tshe bstan pa mi srid pa'o phyir ro zhes pas yang nas yang du 'byung bar dka' bar shes so //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo mtshar che ba'i chos ni dus gzhan gyi tshe bstan pa mi srid pa'o phyir ro zhes pas yang nas yang du 'byung bar dka' bar shes so //
translated: Because such a wondrous Dharma, which is unmistaken, could not possibly have been taught at another time, it is understood that it is difficult for it to occur again and again.

original: shugs las lan gcig las lan gnyis sam gsum du gsungs pa bkag go //🔽yang na dus gcig na zhes pa gang zag dang sbyar na dus gang gi tshe bdag gis 'di thos kyis /
analyzed: shugs las lan gcig las lan gnyis sam gsum du gsungs pa bkag go // yang na dus gcig na zhes pa gang zag dang sbyar na dus gang gi tshe bdag gis 'di thos kyis /
translated: By implication, it refutes that it was taught once, twice, or three times.

original: gzhan gyi tshe gzhan dang gzhan pa'i mdo thos so zhes mang du thos pa nyid du bstan te ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe gzhan dang gzhan pa'i mdo thos so zhes mang du thos pa nyid du bstan te ;
translated: Or, if at one time is applied to the person, it teaches that the person has heard much, thinking, At the time when I heard this, at another time I heard that sūtra.

original: ston pas kyang lan gcig las ma gsungs par 'dug la /
analyzed: ston pas kyang lan gcig las ma gsungs par 'dug la /
translated: The teacher did not teach it more than once,

original: nyan pa'i 'khor gyis kyang lan gcig las ma thos par 'dug pa la /
analyzed: nyan pa'i 'khor gyis kyang lan gcig las ma thos par 'dug pa la /
translated: and the assembly of listeners did not hear it more than once.

original: gzungs 'di bsdus nas 'dug pas gang zag 'di ni mi brjed pa'i gzungs thob pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag cig tu 'dug par shes so ;
analyzed: gzungs 'di bsdus nas 'dug pas gang zag 'di ni mi brjed pa'i gzungs thob pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag cig tu 'dug par shes so ;
translated: Since this dhāraṇī was compiled, it is understood that this person is a person who possesses the attainment of the dhāraṇī of non-forgetfulness.

original: / de ltar shes pas gang zag 'di ni gzungs thob pa dang ldan pa gcig tu 'dug pas /
analyzed: / de ltar shes pas gang zag 'di ni gzungs thob pa dang ldan pa gcig tu 'dug pas /
translated: Thus, knowing this, the person who has attained retention, sitting in one place,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa kho na ltar bsdus pa yod pas //🔽bsgrubs na nus pa yang 'byung la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa kho na ltar bsdus pa yod pas // bsgrubs na nus pa yang 'byung la /
translated: comprehends the Tantra just as the Bhagavat taught it.

original: dngos po gnas lugs kyang yin par shes nas gang zag rnams 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po gnas lugs kyang yin par shes nas gang zag rnams 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he practices, he will be able to understand the abiding nature of things, and people will be drawn to him.

original: shugs las lan gnyis gsum du thos pa bkag go //
analyzed: shugs las lan gnyis gsum du thos pa bkag go //
translated: This is the indirect refutation of hearing it a second or third time.

original: da ni gleng gzhi dngos rgyud kyi rgyu ru 'gro ba bstan te /
analyzed: da ni gleng gzhi dngos rgyud kyi rgyu ru 'gro ba bstan te /
translated: Now, the nidana is taught as the cause of the Tantra.

original: de la gleng gzhi phun sum tshogs pa ni /
analyzed: de la gleng gzhi phun sum tshogs pa ni /
translated: The perfect nidana is

original: dus dang ston pa dang / gnas dang / 'khor dang / chos phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus dang ston pa dang / gnas dang / 'khor dang / chos phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of time, teacher, place, retinue, and teaching.🔽The teaching of the Tantra is also taught as the cause of the arising of the Tantra.

original: rgyud gsungs pa de yang dus khyad par du 'phags pa cig yod na gsung //
analyzed: rgyud gsungs pa de yang dus khyad par du 'phags pa cig yod na gsung //
translated: If there is a special time, it is taught.

original: med na mi gsung bas na //
analyzed: med na mi gsung bas na //
translated: If there is not, it is not taught.

original: dus phun sum tshogs pa rgyud 'byung ba'i rgyur gsungs so //
analyzed: dus phun sum tshogs pa rgyud 'byung ba'i rgyur gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of time is taught as the cause of the arising of the Tantra.

original: gang gi tshe gsungs na bdud btul ba'i dus na gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gsungs na bdud btul ba'i dus na gsungs so //
translated: When was it taught? It was taught at the time of subduing Mara.

original: des na dus gcig na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na dus gcig na zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “at one time. ”

original: de yod kyang 'chad pa po'i @248b ston pa khyad par can cig yod na gsung /
analyzed: de yod kyang 'chad pa po'i @248b ston pa khyad par can cig yod na gsung /
translated: If there is a special teacher who is expounding, it is said that he speaks.

original: med na mi gsung bas na ston pa phun sum tshogs pa rgyud 'byung ba'i rgyur gsungs so //
analyzed: med na mi gsung bas na ston pa phun sum tshogs pa rgyud 'byung ba'i rgyur gsungs so //
translated: If there is not, he does not speak. Therefore, the perfect teacher is said to be the cause for the arising of the tantra.

original: gang las zhes dris na bcom ldan 'das las zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gang las zhes dris na bcom ldan 'das las zhes gsungs te /
translated: If it is asked from whom, it is said that it is from the Bhagavān.

original: bcom zhes pa ni bdud bzhi bcom ste /
analyzed: bcom zhes pa ni bdud bzhi bcom ste /
translated: “ Bhagavān” means the four māras are conquered.🔽Moreover, it is explained that because the four māras are conquered,

original: de yang / nyon mongs bdud sogs 'joms pa dang // bcom pa'i phyir na bcom par bshad //
analyzed: de yang / nyon mongs bdud sogs 'joms pa dang // bcom pa'i phyir na bcom par bshad //
translated: the māras of the afflictions and so on are conquered.

original: nyon mongs shes rab dang 'brel bas //
analyzed: nyon mongs shes rab dang 'brel bas //
translated: Since the afflictions are related to wisdom,

original: de bas shes rab bcom par bshad //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas shes rab bcom par bshad // ces gsungs so //
translated: wisdom is explained as the conqueror.

original: bdud bzhi ni phung po dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud do //
analyzed: bdud bzhi ni phung po dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud do //
translated: The four māras are the māra of the skandhas, the māra of the lord of death, the māra of the devaputras, and the māra of the afflictions.

original: de bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de bcom pa'o //
translated: Those are conquered.

original: bdud bzhi bcom pa la lugs gnyis te gzugs sku dang / chos sku'o //
analyzed: bdud bzhi bcom pa la lugs gnyis te gzugs sku dang / chos sku'o //
translated: There are two systems for conquering the four māras: the form kāya and the dharmakāya.

original: dang po nyon mongs pa'i bdud bcom pa ni //
analyzed: dang po nyon mongs pa'i bdud bcom pa ni //
translated: First, the māra of the afflictions is conquered.

original: spang bya nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag spangs pa'o //
analyzed: spang bya nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag spangs pa'o //
translated: He has eliminated all the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience that are to be eliminated.

original: phung po'i bdud bcom pa ni zag bcas kyi phung po mi len pa tsam mo //
analyzed: phung po'i bdud bcom pa ni zag bcas kyi phung po mi len pa tsam mo //
translated: He has conquered the demon of the aggregates, which means that he does not take up contaminated aggregates.

original: lha'i bu'i bdud bcom pa ni rdo rje gdan gyi spo la bdud btul ba'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu'i bdud bcom pa ni rdo rje gdan gyi spo la bdud btul ba'o //
translated: He has conquered the demon of the son of the gods, which means that he subdued the demon on the peak of Mount Sumeru.🔽He has conquered the demon of the Lord of Death, which means that he has eliminated the Lord of Death.

original: 'chi bdag gi bdud bcom pa ni 'jig rten pa rtag tu re ba sun 'don pa'i don du /
analyzed: 'chi bdag gi bdud bcom pa ni 'jig rten pa rtag tu re ba sun 'don pa'i don du /
translated: In order to disappoint the worldly people who always hope that he will remain,🔽he passed into nirvana at the age of eighty.

original: lo brgyad cu tham pa la sku mya ngan las 'das pa la bram ze su ka tos skye bar 'phyi nas /
analyzed: lo brgyad cu tham pa la sku mya ngan las 'das pa la bram ze su ka tos skye bar 'phyi nas /
translated: The brahmin Sukata was born too late

original: dkar po'i chos ma shes nas /
analyzed: dkar po'i chos ma shes nas /
translated: and did not know the white dharmas.

original: des me tog autpalas lnga phul nas /
analyzed: des me tog autpalas lnga phul nas /
translated: He offered five utpala flowers

original: mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gsol ba btab pas /
analyzed: mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gsol ba btab pas /
translated: and requested that the Buddha not pass into nirvana.

original: lo gnyis de'i ngor bzhugs nas /
analyzed: lo gnyis de'i ngor bzhugs nas /
translated: The Buddha remained for two years in response to that request.

original: brgyad cu rtsa gnyis la mya ngan las 'das te /
analyzed: brgyad cu rtsa gnyis la mya ngan las 'das te /
translated: Then, at the age of eighty-two, he passed into nirvana.

original: tshe la dbang thob pas 'chi bdag gi bdud bcom mo //
analyzed: tshe la dbang thob pas 'chi bdag gi bdud bcom mo //
translated: Since he had attained power over life, he had conquered the demon of the Lord of Death.

original: chos skus bdud bcom pa ni /
analyzed: chos skus bdud bcom pa ni /
translated: He has conquered the demon of the dharmakaya, which means that

original: lha'i bu'i bdud dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud bcom pa 'dra'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu'i bdud dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud bcom pa 'dra'o //
translated: The demon of the sons of the gods and the demon of afflictions are similar in being overcome.

original: phung po'i bdud bcom pa ni zag bcas kyi dngos po thams cad 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: phung po'i bdud bcom pa ni zag bcas kyi dngos po thams cad 'gags pa'o //
translated: The demon of the aggregates is overcome by the cessation of all contaminated things.

original: chos sku la 'gag pa med pas 'chi bdag gi bdud bcom pa'o //
analyzed: chos sku la 'gag pa med pas 'chi bdag gi bdud bcom pa'o //
translated: The demon of death is overcome because there is no cessation in the dharmakāya.

original: ldan zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ldan zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase “endowed with” refers to🔽mastery, good form,🔽glory, fame, wisdom,

original: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa ste //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa ste //
translated: and perfect effort.

original: drug po de la ldan zhes bya //
analyzed: drug po de la ldan zhes bya //
translated: These six are called “endowed.”

original: dbang phyug ces pa ni /
analyzed: dbang phyug ces pa ni /
translated: Mastery

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la bya ste /
translated: is the wisdom of the dharmadhātu.

original: dag pa'i khams dang / ma dag pa'i khams gnyis las /
analyzed: dag pa'i khams dang / ma dag pa'i khams gnyis las /
translated: There are two kinds of realms: pure and impure.

original: ma dag pa'i khams ni so so'i skye ba'i chos nyid de /🔽de la dmigs nas bsgoms na thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin @249a * //
analyzed: ma dag pa'i khams ni so so'i skye ba'i chos nyid de / de la dmigs nas bsgoms na thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin @249a * //
translated: The impure realm is the reality of ordinary beings.🔽If one focuses on that and meditates, one gains mastery in producing common and uncommon qualities.

original: pa'i yon tan skyed pa la dbang byed pas dbang phyug ces bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i yon tan skyed pa la dbang byed pas dbang phyug ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “mastery.”

original: dag pa'i khams zhes bya ba ni phyug po nor la dbang byed pa bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud la ldan pa'i yon tan la dbang sbyor ba'i tshul du dbang byed pas na dbang phyug ces bya'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i khams zhes bya ba ni phyug po nor la dbang byed pa bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud la ldan pa'i yon tan la dbang sbyor ba'i tshul du dbang byed pas na dbang phyug ces bya'o //
translated: The pure realm is called “mastery” because it is like a rich man who has mastery over his wealth, and the qualities that are possessed in the continuum of the Tathagata are mastered in the manner of mastery.

original: gzugs bzang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs bzang zhes pa ni /
translated: “Good form”

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes la bya ste //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes la bya ste //
translated: refers to mirror-like wisdom.

original: 'bras bu'i ming rgyud la btags nas //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ming rgyud la btags nas //
translated: The name of the effect is figuratively designated to the cause.

original: gzugs bzang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs bzang zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “good form.”

original: gzugs bzang ba ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang // dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus 'gro ba sems can rnams la mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs bzang ba ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang // dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus 'gro ba sems can rnams la mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Good form is the thirty-two marks and the eighty minor marks that are displayed to sentient beings in accordance with their aspirations.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku nges par bstan par mdzad pa ste /🔽kha cig gis de bzhin gshegs pa la kha dog sngon por mthong //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku nges par bstan par mdzad pa ste / kha cig gis de bzhin gshegs pa la kha dog sngon por mthong //
translated: The body of the Buddha is definitely displayed.🔽Some see the Tathagata as blue,

original: kha cig gis kha dog ser por mthong /
analyzed: kha cig gis kha dog ser por mthong /
translated: some see him as yellow,

original: 'gro ba gang la gang 'dul ba de dang der snang ba de ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dbang gis byung bas na /
analyzed: 'gro ba gang la gang 'dul ba de dang der snang ba de ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dbang gis byung bas na /
translated: The appearance of that which tames that which is to be tamed, wherever it is to be tamed, arises by the power of mirror-like wisdom.

original: de la gzugs bzang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs bzang zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called “good form.”

original: de la gzugs bzang zhes btags pa'i dgos pa ni /
analyzed: de la gzugs bzang zhes btags pa'i dgos pa ni /
translated: The purpose of designating it as “good form” is

original: sems can la mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cur snang ba de ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dbang gis 'byung bar shes par dgongs so //
analyzed: sems can la mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cur snang ba de ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dbang gis 'byung bar shes par dgongs so //
translated: to understand that the appearance of the thirty-two major marks and eighty minor marks of excellence to sentient beings arises by the power of mirror-like wisdom.

original: dpal dang grags dang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gnas gyur pa mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la bya ba ste /
analyzed: dpal dang grags dang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gnas gyur pa mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la bya ba ste /
translated: “Glory and fame” refers to the wisdom of equality, which is the transformation of the afflicted mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po mthong nas chos thams cad la bdag med par rtogs pa'i dus su /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po mthong nas chos thams cad la bdag med par rtogs pa'i dus su /
translated: When a bodhisattva sees the first ground and realizes the selflessness of all phenomena,

original: bdag dang sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi shes pa thob nas //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi shes pa thob nas //
translated: he attains the knowledge of equality with respect to himself and all sentient beings.

original: bdag sdug bsngal las thar bar 'dod cing bde ba 'dod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bdag sdug bsngal las thar bar 'dod cing bde ba 'dod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as he wishes to be free from suffering and to have happiness,

original: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsal la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsal la /
translated: You should dispel the suffering of all sentient beings.

original: bde ba la dgod pas na bde ba dang phan pa bskyed par byed pa'i rgyu yin pas na dpal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba la dgod pas na bde ba dang phan pa bskyed par byed pa'i rgyu yin pas na dpal zhes bya'o //
translated: He is glorious because he is the cause of generating happiness and benefit, since he removes the suffering of all sentient beings and establishes them in happiness.

original: bdag dang gzhan mnyam por byed pas skyes bu 'di 'dra ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams na med do zhes phyogs bcur snyan pa chen po dang / grags pa phun sum tshogs pa 'byung bas na 'di la grags zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan mnyam por byed pas skyes bu 'di 'dra ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams na med do zhes phyogs bcur snyan pa chen po dang / grags pa phun sum tshogs pa 'byung bas na 'di la grags zhes brjod do //
translated: He is renowned because he is renowned in the ten directions as a great being, since no one like him exists in the world.

original: 'bras bu'i ming rgyu la btags so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ming rgyu la btags so //
translated: The name of the result is metaphorically applied to the cause.

original: ye shes zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Wisdom refers to the wisdom of individual investigation.

original: brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
translated: Perfect effort refers to the wisdom of accomplishing activities,

original: 'jig rten @249b gyi khams thams cad du sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa dpag tu med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas sems can gyi don mdzad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten @249b gyi khams thams cad du sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa dpag tu med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas sems can gyi don mdzad de /
translated: since it performs the benefit of sentient beings through various kinds of emanations in all worldly realms, which are immeasurable and inconceivable.

original: des na / byang thang chen po'i me dang 'dra //
analyzed: des na / byang thang chen po'i me dang 'dra //
translated: Therefore, it is like a fire on the great plain.

original: gsung ngo // de drug gi skal ba dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: gsung ngo // de drug gi skal ba dang ldan pas so //
translated: He is the one who is endowed with those six qualities.

original: 'das zhes ba ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das nas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen pos chos kyi sku thugs su chud pa dang / snying rje chen pos sems can la chags pas phung po lhag med du mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: 'das zhes ba ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das nas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen pos chos kyi sku thugs su chud pa dang / snying rje chen pos sems can la chags pas phung po lhag med du mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
translated: He is the one who has transcended, because he has realized the dharmakaya through the great transcendence of sorrow that does not abide in either samsara or nirvana, and because he does not transcend sorrow into a state without remainder of the aggregates, due to his great compassion, which is his attachment to sentient beings.

original: shes rab chen pos sems can gyi don byed cing 'khor ba na gnas kyang de'i nyes pas mi gos te /
analyzed: shes rab chen pos sems can gyi don byed cing 'khor ba na gnas kyang de'i nyes pas mi gos te /
translated: He is the one who has great wisdom, because he acts for the welfare of sentient beings and abides in samsara, yet is unstained by its faults.

original: dper na padma 'dam la gnas kyang de yis mi gos pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na padma 'dam la gnas kyang de yis mi gos pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: He is like a lotus that grows in the mud, yet is unstained by it.

original: de gnyis yod kyang gnas khyad par du 'phags pa cig yod na gsung med na mi gsung pa na /
analyzed: de gnyis yod kyang gnas khyad par du 'phags pa cig yod na gsung med na mi gsung pa na /
translated: He is the one who speaks, because he speaks when there is a special place, and does not speak when there is not.

original: de de'i rgyu ru gsungs so //
analyzed: de de'i rgyu ru gsungs so //
translated: He is the one who is the cause of that, because he is the cause of the special place.

original: gnas gang du thos zhes 'dri na /🔽rdo rje la bzhugs te /🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnas gang du thos zhes 'dri na / rdo rje la bzhugs te / zhes gsungs so //
translated: He is the one who is asked, Where was it heard?

original: de nas gnas ni rdo rje'i gdan byang chub kyi shing drung ngo //
analyzed: de nas gnas ni rdo rje'i gdan byang chub kyi shing drung ngo //
translated: He is the one who is seated on the vajra seat, under the Bodhi tree.

original: de gsum ka yod kyang rgyud bshad pa'i snod du rung ba cig med na mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: de gsum ka yod kyang rgyud bshad pa'i snod du rung ba cig med na mi gsung ngo //
translated: If those three are present but there is no suitable vessel for the explanation of the tantra, he does not speak.

original: yod na gsung bas na /
analyzed: yod na gsung bas na /
translated: If there is, he speaks.

original: de de'i rgyu ru gsung ngo //
analyzed: de de'i rgyu ru gsung ngo //
translated: Therefore, that is said to be the cause of it.

original: gang dang lhan cig thos zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: gang dang lhan cig thos zhes 'dri na /
translated: When asked, “With whom did you hear it?”

original: bdag gis thos zhes gsung ngo //
analyzed: bdag gis thos zhes gsung ngo //
translated: he says, “I heard it.”

original: 'khor ni bdud btul ba'i dus kyi tshe na yod pa'i phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa /
analyzed: 'khor ni bdud btul ba'i dus kyi tshe na yod pa'i phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa /
translated: As for the retinue, at the time of subduing the demons, there were Vajrapāṇi and so on,

original: phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / lha ma srin sde brgyad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / lha ma srin sde brgyad la sogs pa'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas of the ten directions, and the eight classes of gods and rākṣasas and so on.

original: de bzhi ka yod kyang chos phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: de bzhi ka yod kyang chos phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: If those four are present but the Dharma is not perfect,

original: thog mar dge ba /🔽bar du dge ba /
analyzed: thog mar dge ba / bar du dge ba /
translated: virtuous in the beginning,🔽virtuous in the middle,

original: tha mar dge ba //🔽don bzang po //
analyzed: tha mar dge ba // don bzang po //
translated: and virtuous in the end,🔽with a good meaning,

original: tshig 'bru bzang po //
analyzed: tshig 'bru bzang po //
translated: good words,

original: ma 'dres pa /🔽yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa / yongs su dag pa /
translated: unadulterated,🔽pure,

original: yongs su byang ba /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba /
translated: thoroughly purified,

original: yongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa /
translated: and completely perfect,

original: gsal ba / tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa cig yod na gsung /
analyzed: gsal ba / tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa cig yod na gsung /
translated: and clear, and pure conduct, and so on, he speaks.

original: med na mi gsung bas na de'i rgyu ru gsungs so //
analyzed: med na mi gsung bas na de'i rgyu ru gsungs so //
translated: If not, he does not speak. Therefore, that is said to be the cause of it.

original: gleng gzhi gsungs pa'i dgos pa ni /
analyzed: gleng gzhi gsungs pa'i dgos pa ni /
translated: The purpose of the nidāna is

original: phyi rabs kyi gang zag rnams 'jug par 'gyur ba'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rabs kyi gang zag rnams 'jug par 'gyur ba'i dgos pa'o //
translated: the purpose of engaging future persons.

original: rgyud 'byung ba'i rgyu gleng gzhi phun sum tshogs pa rkyen gleng slong ba dang bcas pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: rgyud 'byung ba'i rgyu gleng gzhi phun sum tshogs pa rkyen gleng slong ba dang bcas pa bshad zin to /
translated: The cause of the arising of the tantra, the perfect nidāna, together with the conditions of the introduction, has been explained.

original: // / da ni rgyud dngos ston te /
analyzed: // / da ni rgyud dngos ston te /
translated: Now, the actual tantra is explained.

original: de la bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la bzhi ste /
translated: There are four topics:

original: bsnyen sgrub rnam pa gnyis kyi sngon du 'gro ba'i cho ga yan lag drug gis bdag nyid ltar ji ltar bskyed pa'i tshul bstan pa dang / @250a * //
analyzed: bsnyen sgrub rnam pa gnyis kyi sngon du 'gro ba'i cho ga yan lag drug gis bdag nyid ltar ji ltar bskyed pa'i tshul bstan pa dang / @250a * //
translated: The explanation of the method of self-generation by means of the six-branched yoga that is preliminary to the two, approach and accomplishment;

original: bsnyen sgrub gang gi don du bya ba'i gdul bya bstan pa dang / bsnyen pa'i dus su mchog tu sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan la bcom ldan 'das dgyes pas /
analyzed: bsnyen sgrub gang gi don du bya ba'i gdul bya bstan pa dang / bsnyen pa'i dus su mchog tu sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan la bcom ldan 'das dgyes pas /
translated: the explanation of the disciples for whom the approach and accomplishment are performed; the explanation of the supreme meditative concentration of abiding in sound at the time of approach; and the explanation of the supreme meditative concentration of abiding in the mind at the time of accomplishment.🔽The explanation of the method of self-generation by means of the six-branched yoga that is preliminary to the two, approach and accomplishment, is as follows:

original: sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan bya bar bstan pa dang / sgrub pa'i dus su bum pa'i mtshan nyid bzlas brjod bya ba'i grangs nges pas khrus byas ba'i gang zag nye bar mtshon te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan bya bar bstan pa dang / sgrub pa'i dus su bum pa'i mtshan nyid bzlas brjod bya ba'i grangs nges pas khrus byas ba'i gang zag nye bar mtshon te bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the concentration abiding in sound, and the explanation of the person who has been purified by the definite number of recitations of the characteristics of the vase at the time of practice.

original: de'i dang po las dpyod dmigs drug yod de skabs skabs su ngo sprad do //
analyzed: de'i dang po las dpyod dmigs drug yod de skabs skabs su ngo sprad do //
translated: The first of those has six topics of analysis of the activity, which are introduced from time to time.

original: gsang sngags spyi'i rnam par gzhag pa cig bshad de /
analyzed: gsang sngags spyi'i rnam par gzhag pa cig bshad de /
translated: One should explain the general arrangement of secret mantra.

original: bsam gtan phyi ma las //
analyzed: bsam gtan phyi ma las //
translated: In the Continuation of the Concentration Tantra, it states:

original: lha yi sku yi gnas de la /
analyzed: lha yi sku yi gnas de la /
translated: In the abode of the deity’s body,

original: dang po kho nar mchod nas ni //
analyzed: dang po kho nar mchod nas ni //
translated: first make offerings

original: rnal 'byor gnas bcas shes rab can //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gnas bcas shes rab can //
translated: and then the wise one with yoga

original: bde gshegs mdun du bsams na ni //
analyzed: bde gshegs mdun du bsams na ni //
translated: visualizes the Sugata in front.

original: phyi nas yan lag rnam par grol //
analyzed: phyi nas yan lag rnam par grol //
translated: Later, the limbs are liberated

original: mi 'byed 'byed pa rnam par spangs //
analyzed: mi 'byed 'byed pa rnam par spangs //
translated: and non-division is abandoned.

original: phra ba mi g-yo gsal ba ste /
analyzed: phra ba mi g-yo gsal ba ste /
translated: The subtle is unwavering and clear,

original: blo yi spyod pa mdun na gnas //
analyzed: blo yi spyod pa mdun na gnas //
translated: the activity of the mind is in front.

original: bdag nyid 'di 'bra bzhag nas ni //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'di 'bra bzhag nas ni //
translated: Having placed the self in this way,

original: gsang sngags rnam par shes pas bsgos //
analyzed: gsang sngags rnam par shes pas bsgos //
translated: meditate with the awareness of secret mantra.

original: bsdams nas ting nge 'dzin la gnas //
analyzed: bsdams nas ting nge 'dzin la gnas //
translated: Having restrained, abide in samādhi.

original: srog dang rtsol ba rab tu bsdus //
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba rab tu bsdus //
translated: The life-force and exertion are fully contracted.

original: gnyid spangs nas ni rnam par bsam //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyid spangs nas ni rnam par bsam // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Having abandoned sleep, one should contemplate.

original: de yang / lha yi drung nas mchod nas ni //
analyzed: de yang / lha yi drung nas mchod nas ni //
translated: And also: Having made offerings in the presence of the deity,

original: bya ba'i bar tshig rkang gnyis kyis tshogs bsags pa bstan to //
analyzed: bya ba'i bar tshig rkang gnyis kyis tshogs bsags pa bstan to //
translated: The two lines from the accumulation of merit up to the accumulation of wisdom show the accumulation of merit and wisdom.

original: rnal 'byor bya ba bsams nas ni //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bya ba bsams nas ni //
translated: Having contemplated the yoga to be performed,

original: tshig rkang gnyis kyis ni /
analyzed: tshig rkang gnyis kyis ni /
translated: The two lines from the yoga to be performed up to the yoga to be performed show the yoga of the deity.

original: 'dug thabs dang gsol ba btab ste /
analyzed: 'dug thabs dang gsol ba btab ste /
translated: Having sat in the posture and supplicated,

original: phyi nas bya ba nas bzhag nas ni bya ba'i bar gyis tshig rkang lnga las mi rtogs pa'i lha bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: phyi nas bya ba nas bzhag nas ni bya ba'i bar gyis tshig rkang lnga las mi rtogs pa'i lha bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: The five lines from having sat in the posture up to having placed show the meditation on the deity without discursive thought.

original: gsang sngags rnam par shes pas bsgos //
analyzed: gsang sngags rnam par shes pas bsgos //
translated: The mantra is meditated on with consciousness.

original: zhes pa ni bdag dang lha'i de kho na nyid bsre ba dang / lha'i gzhi bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bdag dang lha'i de kho na nyid bsre ba dang / lha'i gzhi bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the mixing of the suchness of oneself and the deity, and the meditation on the basis of the deity.

original: bsngags nas ting nge 'dzin la gnas //🔽zhes pa nas /
analyzed: bsngags nas ting nge 'dzin la gnas // zhes pa nas /
translated: Having praised, one abides in samādhi.

original: rnam par bsam bya ba'i tshig rkang ba gsum gyis ni ting nge 'dzin gyi lha bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par bsam bya ba'i tshig rkang ba gsum gyis ni ting nge 'dzin gyi lha bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: The three lines from having praised up to one should contemplate show the meditation on the samādhi deity.

original: sangs rgyas gsang sngags ni de de ltar gsal bar bsams gtan phyi ma'i t'i kar gsung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gsang sngags ni de de ltar gsal bar bsams gtan phyi ma'i t'i kar gsung ngo //
translated: The Buddha's secret mantra is taught in the latter part of the Tantra.

original: gzungs 'di dang sbyar na /
analyzed: gzungs 'di dang sbyar na /
translated: When applied to this dhāraṇī,

original: bcom ldan 'das bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bya ba nas /
translated: from the Blessed One up to

original: byin gyis brlabs nas zhes pas lha drug sgom pa'i sngon du gsol ba btab pa bstan to //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs nas zhes pas lha drug sgom pa'i sngon du gsol ba btab pa bstan to //
translated: having blessed shows the supplication prior to meditating on the six deities.

original: rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes pas rnam @250b bar mi rtog pa'i lha bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes pas rnam @250b bar mi rtog pa'i lha bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: Enters into the vajra samādhi shows the meditation on the non-conceptual deity.

original: de nas lag na rdo rje zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas lag na rdo rje zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, from Vajrapāṇi up to

original: rdo rje khro bo las byung ba zhes pas stong pa nyid las sdang ba'i thabs bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje khro bo las byung ba zhes pas stong pa nyid las sdang ba'i thabs bstan to //
translated: arisen from the vajra wrath shows the method of subduing hatred through emptiness.

original: rdo rje snying pos zhes pa nas /
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos zhes pa nas /
translated: From Vajra Essence up to

original: lag na rdo rjes rab tu smras zhes pas lha drug gi yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: lag na rdo rjes rab tu smras zhes pas lha drug gi yon tan bstan to //
translated: Vajrapāṇi spoke shows the qualities of the six deities.

original: na mo ratna tra y'a ya bya ba nas ;
analyzed: na mo ratna tra y'a ya bya ba nas ;
translated: Namo ratnatrayāya up to

original: aa mri te h'um phat ces bya ba'i bar du /
analyzed: aa mri te h'um phat ces bya ba'i bar du /
translated: amṛte hūṃ phaṭ

original: sgra'i lha dang yi ge'i lha bstan to //
analyzed: sgra'i lha dang yi ge'i lha bstan to //
translated: shows the sound deity and the letter deity.

original: sdig pa thams cad byang byas nas //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad byang byas nas //
translated: Having purified all misdeeds,

original: bya ba nas /
analyzed: bya ba nas /
translated: From the activities,🔽🔽

original: dpal kun gyis ni legs par brgyan //
analyzed: dpal kun gyis ni legs par brgyan //
translated: ...adorned with all splendor.

original: bya bas gzugs kyi lha bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: bya bas gzugs kyi lha bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the meditation on the deity of form.

original: phyag rgya ting nge 'dzin gyi lha ni spyi'i rgyud las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya ting nge 'dzin gyi lha ni spyi'i rgyud las shes par bya'o //
translated: The deity of meditative absorption of the seal should be understood from the general tantras.

original: de las gzungs 'di'i mngon rtogs kyi rim pa nyams su blang ba ni dang por phyi nang gi khrus rnam pa gnyis byas la /
analyzed: de las gzungs 'di'i mngon rtogs kyi rim pa nyams su blang ba ni dang por phyi nang gi khrus rnam pa gnyis byas la /
translated: From that, the stages of the practical application of the clear realization of this dhāraṇī are as follows: First, perform the two types of outer and inner ablutions.

original: ku sha'i steng du stan bde ba la nye bar 'dug ste /
analyzed: ku sha'i steng du stan bde ba la nye bar 'dug ste /
translated: Sit on a comfortable seat on kuśa grass.

original: de'i char gtogs pa 'thor 'thung dang nye reg byas la /
analyzed: de'i char gtogs pa 'thor 'thung dang nye reg byas la /
translated: Sprinkle and sip the water that is part of that.

original: bdag nyid skad cig gis lha gang rung du bskyed la /
analyzed: bdag nyid skad cig gis lha gang rung du bskyed la /
translated: Instantly generate yourself as any deity.

original: mig gnyis su ram las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor re bsams la /
analyzed: mig gnyis su ram las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor re bsams la /
translated: In the two eyes, imagine a sun maṇḍala from raṃ.

original: de'i steng du h'um las ye shes kyi 'od zer can re re bsams la /
analyzed: de'i steng du h'um las ye shes kyi 'od zer can re re bsams la /
translated: On that, imagine a jñānadākinī from hūṃ.

original: de las 'od zer 'phros pas bgegs thams cad bsregs par bsams la /
analyzed: de las 'od zer 'phros pas bgegs thams cad bsregs par bsams la /
translated: Light rays radiate from that and burn all obstructors.

original: ngag tu hu'm ring brjod cing bgegs thams cad bskrad cing mtshams bcad pa dang / nang gi khrus byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa byas la /
analyzed: ngag tu hu'm ring brjod cing bgegs thams cad bskrad cing mtshams bcad pa dang / nang gi khrus byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa byas la /
translated: Then, having performed the inner ablution and aroused the mind of supreme awakening, and so forth,

original: bdag nyid lha'i sku phyag rgya chen por bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid lha'i sku phyag rgya chen por bsgom par bya'o //
translated: meditate on your own body as the deity’s body, the great seal.

original: de yang dang por kri ya don gyi lha drug bsgom par bya ste //
analyzed: de yang dang por kri ya don gyi lha drug bsgom par bya ste //
translated: Furthermore, first meditate on the six deities of the meaning of the Kriyā Tantra.

original: de la dang por bdag nyid las kyi rdo rje sems dpa'am /
analyzed: de la dang por bdag nyid las kyi rdo rje sems dpa'am /
translated: For that, first imagine yourself as Karma-vajrasattva,

original: yang na tha mal pa'i lus sam /
analyzed: yang na tha mal pa'i lus sam /
translated: or else in an ordinary body,

original: lha gang rung cig tu mos pa byas la /
analyzed: lha gang rung cig tu mos pa byas la /
translated: or as any deity you like.

original: mdun gyi nam mkha' la bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa bdud btul nas sa gnon gyi phyag rgya can /
analyzed: mdun gyi nam mkha' la bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa bdud btul nas sa gnon gyi phyag rgya can /
translated: In the space in front of you, instantly imagine Bhagavat Śākyamuni, who has subdued Māra, has the earth-touching mudra,

original: seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa cig tu skad cig gis bsams la /
analyzed: seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa cig tu skad cig gis bsams la /
translated: and is seated on a lion throne.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi lus rdo rjer byin gyis brlab tu gsol zhes brjod pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi lus rdo rjer byin gyis brlab tu gsol zhes brjod pas /
translated: Say, “Bhagavat, please bless my body to be vajra.”

original: des kyang bdag nyid kyi lus stong par byin gyis brlabs par bsams te /
analyzed: des kyang bdag nyid kyi lus stong par byin gyis brlabs par bsams te /
translated: Imagine that he blesses your body to be empty.

original: dngos po thams cad gzung ba med pa /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad gzung ba med pa /
translated: One should contemplate that all things are ungraspable,

original: 'dzin pa med pa /
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa /
translated: without grasping,

original: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba nam mkha' lta bur bsam mo //🔽de nas stong pa nyid zhi ba phyogs gcig pa 'ba' zhig @251a * //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba nam mkha' lta bur bsam mo // de nas stong pa nyid zhi ba phyogs gcig pa 'ba' zhig @251a * //
translated: free from all conceptual elaborations, like space.🔽Then, fearing that one will not be able to benefit beings with just the one-sided peace of emptiness,

original: gis 'gro ba'i don bya bar mi nus pa dang / nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba'i byang chub dang khyad par med par song ste dogs nas /
analyzed: gis 'gro ba'i don bya bar mi nus pa dang / nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba'i byang chub dang khyad par med par song ste dogs nas /
translated: and fearing that one will end up no different from the awakening of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: bcom ldan 'das dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'od zer ram phyag gis reg nas mngon sum du bslang ngam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'od zer ram phyag gis reg nas mngon sum du bslang ngam /
translated: one is directly roused from that by the light rays or hand of the Blessed One or a bodhisattva.

original: yang na de gnyis ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i dbang gis /
analyzed: yang na de gnyis ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i dbang gis /
translated: Or else, through the power of the bodhisattva’s entry into samādhi,

original: bdag nyid stong pa nyid las bslang ngo //
analyzed: bdag nyid stong pa nyid las bslang ngo //
translated: one is roused from emptiness by oneself.

original: gal te skur bslang ngam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skur bslang ngam zhe na /
translated: If one is roused by a form,

original: ma yin te /🔽stong pa nyid kyi sems rtse gcig pa'i rnam pa ma dor ba la /
analyzed: ma yin te / stong pa nyid kyi sems rtse gcig pa'i rnam pa ma dor ba la /
translated: no.🔽Without losing the aspect of the mind of emptiness one-pointedly,

original: stong pa nyid kyi sems dpyod pa dang bcas pa cig tu bslang ngo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi sems dpyod pa dang bcas pa cig tu bslang ngo //
translated: one is roused by the mind of emptiness together with analysis.

original: ji ltar dpyod na bdag gi de kho na nyid ni /🔽gzung ba med pa /
analyzed: ji ltar dpyod na bdag gi de kho na nyid ni / gzung ba med pa /
translated: The reality of the self

original: 'dzin pa med pa /
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa /
translated: is without an object to be grasped,🔽without a subject that grasps,

original: spos pa thams cad dang bral bar 'dug na /
analyzed: spos pa thams cad dang bral bar 'dug na /
translated: and is free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: lha'i de kho na nyid ji ltar 'dug par dpyad pas /
analyzed: lha'i de kho na nyid ji ltar 'dug par dpyad pas /
translated: When one analyzes how the reality of the deity is,

original: lha'i de kho na nyid de yang don dam par spros pa thams cad dang bral par 'dug par shes so //
analyzed: lha'i de kho na nyid de yang don dam par spros pa thams cad dang bral par 'dug par shes so //
translated: one understands that the reality of the deity is also, in the ultimate, free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: de ltar shes pas stong ba nyid kyi rnam pa la dbye ba med las gcig cing tha mi dad pa med pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar shes pas stong ba nyid kyi rnam pa la dbye ba med las gcig cing tha mi dad pa med pa yin /
translated: By understanding it in that way, the aspect of emptiness is undivided, single, and not different.

original: de med tsam na bdag dang lha'i de kho na nyid de yang gcig cing tha mi dad par 'dug / de ltar 'dug tsa na bdag gi de kho na nyid gang yin pa de lha'i de kho na nyid yin la /
analyzed: de med tsam na bdag dang lha'i de kho na nyid de yang gcig cing tha mi dad par 'dug / de ltar 'dug tsa na bdag gi de kho na nyid gang yin pa de lha'i de kho na nyid yin la /
translated: When that is not there, the reality of the self and the reality of the deity are also single and not different.

original: lha'i de kho na nyid gang yin pa de bdag gi de kho na nyid yin par shes so //
analyzed: lha'i de kho na nyid gang yin pa de bdag gi de kho na nyid yin par shes so //
translated: When that is the case, one understands that whatever is the reality of the self is the reality of the deity,🔽and whatever is the reality of the deity is the reality of the self.

original: de shes pas rang dang lha'i de kho na nyid gcig cing tha mi dad par ro gcig tu gyur par bsam mo //
analyzed: de shes pas rang dang lha'i de kho na nyid gcig cing tha mi dad par ro gcig tu gyur par bsam mo //
translated: By knowing that, one should think that one's own and the deity's reality are one and the same, and are of one taste, without being different.

original: gcig cing tha mi dad par bsams pa de las yon tan gang thob na /
analyzed: gcig cing tha mi dad par bsams pa de las yon tan gang thob na /
translated: What good qualities are obtained from thinking that they are one and the same, without being different?

original: lha'i de kho na nyid la rang gi phun sum tshogs pa rdo rje'i chos bdun dang / gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa de mdzad pa rnam pa bzhi yod pa de dag gi de kho na nyid la bsgos nas ldan par bsam mo //
analyzed: lha'i de kho na nyid la rang gi phun sum tshogs pa rdo rje'i chos bdun dang / gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa de mdzad pa rnam pa bzhi yod pa de dag gi de kho na nyid la bsgos nas ldan par bsam mo //
translated: One should think that one is endowed with the reality of the deity's seven vajra qualities of one's own excellence and the four kinds of activities of others' excellence, having anointed oneself with that reality.

original: bdag dang lha'i de kho na nyid gcig tu bsres pas dgos pa gnyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: bdag dang lha'i de kho na nyid gcig tu bsres pas dgos pa gnyis 'byung ste /
translated: By mixing one's own and the deity's reality into one, two purposes arise.

original: bdag dang lha ru tha dad pa'i 'du shes kyang 'gog pa /
analyzed: bdag dang lha ru tha dad pa'i 'du shes kyang 'gog pa /
translated: One also stops the perception of oneself and the deity as being different.

original: bdag nyid kyi lus sems byin rlabs can cig tu byas te gzhag go //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi lus sems byin rlabs can cig tu byas te gzhag go //
translated: One should place one's own body and mind in a state of blessing.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i lha sgom pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i lha sgom pa rdzogs so /
translated: The meditation on the nonconceptual deity is complete.

original: // / da ni sgra'i lha bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni sgra'i lha bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Now one should meditate on the deity of sound.

original: bdag nyid kyi sems stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i rjes /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sems stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i rjes /
translated: After one's own mind rests in emptiness,

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la /
translated: In the second moment,

original: dper na nam mkha' stong pa la glo bur du 'brug gi sgra rnam pa drag po grag pa ltar bsams te /🔽rang gi sems nyid @251b na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' stong pa la glo bur du 'brug gi sgra rnam pa drag po grag pa ltar bsams te / rang gi sems nyid @251b na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
translated: like a sudden, violent clap of thunder in empty space,

original: bya ba nas aa mri te h'um phat bya ba'i bar du sgra'i rnam par grags par bsam mo //
analyzed: bya ba nas aa mri te h'um phat bya ba'i bar du sgra'i rnam par grags par bsam mo //
translated: one should think that one's own mind itself appears in the form of the sound from namaḥ ratnatrayāya up to amṛte hūṃ phaṭ.

original: sgra'i lha bsgom pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sgra'i lha bsgom pa rdzogs so /
translated: The meditation on the sound deity is complete.

original: // / de nas rang gi sems yi ge'i rnam par gsal bar snang ba la /
analyzed: // / de nas rang gi sems yi ge'i rnam par gsal bar snang ba la /
translated: Then, one's mind appearing in the form of syllables

original: kun rdzob byang chub sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor cig chags bar bsam mo //
analyzed: kun rdzob byang chub sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor cig chags bar bsam mo //
translated: is imagined to be a complete relative awakening mind moon mandala.

original: dper na gser phye ma dngul chu la chags pa bzhin no //🔽de yang phyi nas bltas na nang gsal ba /
analyzed: dper na gser phye ma dngul chu la chags pa bzhin no // de yang phyi nas bltas na nang gsal ba /
translated: For example, it is like gold dust adhering to quicksilver.🔽Moreover, it should be viewed as an image that is clear inside when seen from outside,

original: nang nas bltas na phyi gsal ba'i gzugs brnyan gyi rnam par blta'o //
analyzed: nang nas bltas na phyi gsal ba'i gzugs brnyan gyi rnam par blta'o //
translated: and clear outside when seen from inside.

original: yi ge'i lha bsgom pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: yi ge'i lha bsgom pa rdzogs so /
translated: The meditation on the syllable deity is complete.

original: // / de nas zla ba'i steng du gzungs las 'od zer 'phros pas /
analyzed: // / de nas zla ba'i steng du gzungs las 'od zer 'phros pas /
translated: Then, light rays radiate from the dhāraṇī on the moon.

original: de'i sna la bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa dpag tu med pa /
analyzed: de'i sna la bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa dpag tu med pa /
translated: Immeasurable Bhagavat Vajravidāraṇa arise from the nose of the deity.

original: nam mkha'i mtha' gtugs pa khengs pa byung ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtha' gtugs pa khengs pa byung ste /
translated: They fill the reaches of space.

original: mdzad pa rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas 'gro ba rigs drug gi sems can rnams kyi gnas su 'phros pas /
analyzed: mdzad pa rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas 'gro ba rigs drug gi sems can rnams kyi gnas su 'phros pas /
translated: They emanate to the abodes of the sentient beings of the six realms through the four types of activity.

original: so so'i las kyi sdig sgrib sbyangs /
analyzed: so so'i las kyi sdig sgrib sbyangs /
translated: They purify the negative karma and obscurations of each one.

original: sdug bsngal med par byas te thar pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa la bkod /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med par byas te thar pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa la bkod /
translated: They make them free of suffering and establish them in liberation and omniscience.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mchod pa'i sprin chen pos mchod /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mchod pa'i sprin chen pos mchod /
translated: They make offerings to the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions with great clouds of offerings.

original: thugs dam gyi rgyud bskul /
analyzed: thugs dam gyi rgyud bskul /
translated: They arouse their mind streams.🔽They gather the two accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis bsags nas slar tshur 'dus nas zla ba'i steng gi gzungs la thim /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis bsags nas slar tshur 'dus nas zla ba'i steng gi gzungs la thim /
translated: They return and dissolve into the dhāraṇī on the moon.

original: gzungs zla ba dang bcas pa yongs su gyur pa las bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa /
analyzed: gzungs zla ba dang bcas pa yongs su gyur pa las bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa /
translated: The dhāraṇī and the moon completely transform into oneself as Bhagavat Śrī Vajravidāraṇa.

original: zhal gcig pa /
analyzed: zhal gcig pa /
translated: He has one face.

original: phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa /
translated: He has two arms.

original: sku mdog sngon po //
analyzed: sku mdog sngon po //
translated: He is blue in color.

original: phyag g-yas kyis rdo rje rgya gram las rva phyogs gcig med pa bsnams pa thugs kar 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas kyis rdo rje rgya gram las rva phyogs gcig med pa bsnams pa thugs kar 'dzin pa /
translated: His right hand holds a vajra cross with one prong missing, which he holds at his heart.

original: g-yon pa rdo rje khu chur dkur bsten pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa rdo rje khu chur dkur bsten pa /
translated: His left hand holds a vajra-handled bell at his hip.

original: cung zad khro ba la sgeg cing 'gying bag dang bcas pa /
analyzed: cung zad khro ba la sgeg cing 'gying bag dang bcas pa /
translated: He is slightly wrathful, with a charming and haughty bearing.

original: dbu rgyan rtse phran dang / rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: dbu rgyan rtse phran dang / rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with a crown of jewels and all the ornaments.

original: rin po che'i khri stengs na rgyal po rol pa'i tshul du bzhugs par bsgom mo //
analyzed: rin po che'i khri stengs na rgyal po rol pa'i tshul du bzhugs par bsgom mo //
translated: Meditate on him sitting on a jeweled throne in the manner of a reclining king.

original: gzungs kyi lha bsgom pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gzungs kyi lha bsgom pa rdzogs so /
translated: The meditation on the dhāraṇī deity is complete.

original: // / de nas lag pa gnyis thal mo sbyar te /
analyzed: // / de nas lag pa gnyis thal mo sbyar te /
translated: Then, with your two palms joined in añjali,

original: srin lag gnyis nang du bcug la /
analyzed: srin lag gnyis nang du bcug la /
translated: insert your two ring fingers inside.

original: gung mo gnyis bsgreng la /
analyzed: gung mo gnyis bsgreng la /
translated: Raise your two middle fingers

original: mdzub mo gnyis gung mo'i rgyab tu nas gang tsam gyis ma 'byar bar byas la /
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis gung mo'i rgyab tu nas gang tsam gyis ma 'byar bar byas la /
translated: and separate your two index fingers so that they are about the width of a hair away from the back of the middle fingers.

original: mthe bong gnyis dang mthe'u chung gnyis bsgreng ste /
analyzed: mthe bong gnyis dang mthe'u chung gnyis bsgreng ste /
translated: Raise your two thumbs and two pinkies

original: khro bo'i rdo rje rtse lnga ba @252a * //🔽ltar byas la /
analyzed: khro bo'i rdo rje rtse lnga ba @252a * // ltar byas la /
translated: in the shape of a five-pronged wrathful vajra.

original: aom badzra dzva l'a ya tva zhes brjod cing /
analyzed: aom badzra dzva l'a ya tva zhes brjod cing /
translated: Recite oṃ vajra jñāna jñāna.

original: snying ga dang / lkog ma dang / spyi bo dang / dpung pa g-yas g-yon du gtugs te byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: snying ga dang / lkog ma dang / spyi bo dang / dpung pa g-yas g-yon du gtugs te byin gyis brlab po //
translated: Touch the heart, throat, crown, and right and left shoulders to consecrate.

original: de ltar byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas /
translated: Having done that,

original: sngar kun brtags kyi lha yin pa la /
analyzed: sngar kun brtags kyi lha yin pa la /
translated: previously the imagined deity

original: des gzhan dbang gi lha rgyu rkyen las grub pa'i lha dngos gcig tu bsam mo //
analyzed: des gzhan dbang gi lha rgyu rkyen las grub pa'i lha dngos gcig tu bsam mo //
translated: is thought to be the dependent deity, the deity that is established from causes and conditions.

original: phyag rgya'i lha rdzogs so /
analyzed: phyag rgya'i lha rdzogs so /
