original: gug skyed klad kor tsheg drag nyams par min //
analyzed: gug skyed klad kor tsheg drag nyams par min //
translated: not impaired by curls, dots, or punctuation.

original: tshul ni de ltar byas na yon tan ni //
analyzed: tshul ni de ltar byas na yon tan ni //
translated: If done in this way, the qualities are as follows:

original: bzlas brjod me la tshul khrims rlung gis spar //
analyzed: bzlas brjod me la tshul khrims rlung gis spar //
translated: Recitation is fanned by the wind of discipline,

original: brtson 'grus chen po'i me lces bskal pa'i sdig dpung bsreg / bskal pa grangs med 'das pa'i sngon rol nas //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po'i me lces bskal pa'i sdig dpung bsreg / bskal pa grangs med 'das pa'i sngon rol nas //
translated: Before the eons are transcended,

original: mtshams med lnga la sogs te mi dge bcu spyad pa'i //
analyzed: mtshams med lnga la sogs te mi dge bcu spyad pa'i //
translated: the ten nonvirtues are practiced, such as the five heinous acts.

original: sdig pa gang yin bzlas brjod byas pas 'byang bar byed //
analyzed: sdig pa gang yin bzlas brjod byas pas 'byang bar byed //
translated: Whatever evil there is, it is purified by recitation.

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said.

original: gsang sngags dngos su bdag nyid 'don kyang //
analyzed: gsang sngags dngos su bdag nyid 'don kyang //
translated: Even though the mantra is recited by oneself,

original: lha'i skus 'don par bsam mo //
analyzed: lha'i skus 'don par bsam mo //
translated: it is imagined that the deity’s form recites it.

original: bzlas brjod tshar re zhing spro bsdus sems can gyi don byed cing bzlas so //
analyzed: bzlas brjod tshar re zhing spro bsdus sems can gyi don byed cing bzlas so //
translated: Recite while emanating and gathering for the benefit of sentient beings at the end of each recitation.

original: yang na rdo rje lte ba'i sa bon las //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje lte ba'i sa bon las //
translated: Alternatively, from the seed syllable in the center of the vajra,

original: 'od zer kha dog lnga dang lha'i sku dpag tu med cing bsam gyis mi khyab par spros pas /
analyzed: 'od zer kha dog lnga dang lha'i sku dpag tu med cing bsam gyis mi khyab par spros pas /
translated: light rays and immeasurable and inconceivable forms of the deity emanate in five colors.

original: bgegs dang log 'dren thams cad dang / mngon par zhen pa thams cad bsregs par bsam zhing lha'i sku de tsho'i zhal nas gsang sngags 'don tsam na /
analyzed: bgegs dang log 'dren thams cad dang / mngon par zhen pa thams cad bsregs par bsam zhing lha'i sku de tsho'i zhal nas gsang sngags 'don tsam na /
translated: Imagine that all obstructors and misleaders and all clinging are burned.

original: de rnams kyi rna bar rgyob rgyob sod sod zer bar thos par bsam mo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rna bar rgyob rgyob sod sod zer bar thos par bsam mo //
translated: Imagine that they hear the sound of “Strike! Strike! Kill! Kill!” in their ears.

original: de ltar bzlas brjod zin nas /
analyzed: de ltar bzlas brjod zin nas /
translated: Having thus completed the recitation,

original: bstod pa'i rgyal po gang yang rung bas bstod do //
analyzed: bstod pa'i rgyal po gang yang rung bas bstod do //
translated: one should praise with any king of praises.

original: de nas khrus la sogs pa khrus kyi cho ga las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas khrus la sogs pa khrus kyi cho ga las shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, the bathing and so forth should be understood from the bathing ritual.

original: de nas ye shes sems dpa' gshegs su gsol /🔽rang lha'i @254a * //
analyzed: de nas ye shes sems dpa' gshegs su gsol / rang lha'i @254a * //
translated: Then, request the departure of the awareness beings.

original: nga rgyal gyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should abide with the pride of one’s deity.

original: spyi rgyud thams cad bsgom pa'i lugs rdzogs so /
analyzed: spyi rgyud thams cad bsgom pa'i lugs rdzogs so /
translated: The system of meditation on all the general tantras is complete.

original: // / spyi'i rgyud kyi rnam par gzhag pa dang / mngon rtogs lam gyi rim pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: // / spyi'i rgyud kyi rnam par gzhag pa dang / mngon rtogs lam gyi rim pa rdzogs so /
translated: The general presentation of the tantra and the stages of the path of clear realization are complete.

original: // / dang por bdag nyid chos drug gis lhar bskyed pa'i sngon du ji ltar byin gyis brlabs pa'i gsol ba gdab pa'i thabs bstan pa ni /
analyzed: // / dang por bdag nyid chos drug gis lhar bskyed pa'i sngon du ji ltar byin gyis brlabs pa'i gsol ba gdab pa'i thabs bstan pa ni /
translated: First, the method of supplicating the consecration just as it was done previously, generating oneself as the deity through the six deities, is explained:

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni /
translated: “Bhagavat”

original: mtshan gyi don gyi skabs su bshad pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mtshan gyi don gyi skabs su bshad pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: is as explained in the section on the meaning of the name.

original: rdo rje la bzhugs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje la bzhugs zhes pa ni /
translated: “Residing on a lotus and moon”🔽is as explained above.

original: de gshegs pa'i gnas de la rdo rje zhes pa ni /🔽dper na rdo rje pha lam la /
analyzed: de gshegs pa'i gnas de la rdo rje zhes pa ni / dper na rdo rje pha lam la /
translated: The place where he went is called “vajra.”🔽For example, the five great elements cannot harm a diamond.

original: 'byung ba chen po lngas gnod par bya bar mi nus pa de bzhin du de la me bdun chu gcig gis bshigs par mi nus pas na /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po lngas gnod par bya bar mi nus pa de bzhin du de la me bdun chu gcig gis bshigs par mi nus pas na /
translated: In the same way, the seven fires and one water cannot destroy it.

original: rdo rje zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called “vajra.”

original: rdo rje la bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje la bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Residing on the vajra” means

original: kri la spyi'i rgyud las bzhugs tshul gsum ste /
analyzed: kri la spyi'i rgyud las bzhugs tshul gsum ste /
translated: in the general tantra of kriya, there are three ways of residing:

original: bkra shis pa'i skyil krung dang / padma'i skyil krung dang / rdo rje'i skyil krung dang gsum las 'di ni rdo rje'i skyil krung du bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bkra shis pa'i skyil krung dang / padma'i skyil krung dang / rdo rje'i skyil krung dang gsum las 'di ni rdo rje'i skyil krung du bzhugs pa'o //
translated: the auspicious cross-legged posture, the lotus cross-legged posture, and the vajra cross-legged posture.

original: yang na rdo rje la bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na rdo rje la bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Residing on the vajra” means

original: bzhugs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bzhugs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: there are four ways of residing:

original: spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa dang / 'chad pas bzhugs pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pas bzhugs pa dang / nang du yang dag 'jog gis bzhugs pa'o ;
analyzed: spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa dang / 'chad pas bzhugs pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pas bzhugs pa dang / nang du yang dag 'jog gis bzhugs pa'o ;
translated: residing in conduct, residing in explanation, residing in equipoise, and residing in perfect placement.

original: ; sku'i phrin las su bgrangs pa gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: ; sku'i phrin las su bgrangs pa gang yang rung ste /
translated: Any of these can be counted as the activity of the body.

original: de dag thams cad ni spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: All of these are the activities of his body.

original: gsung gi phrin las gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni chos 'chad pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gsung gi phrin las gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni chos 'chad pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: All of his activities of speech are the activity of teaching the Dharma.

original: thugs kyi phrin las gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni de dag las bzhugs pa gnyis te /🔽rtag tu mnyam par bzhugs pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi phrin las gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni de dag las bzhugs pa gnyis te / rtag tu mnyam par bzhugs pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i bzhugs pa'o //
translated: All of his activities of mind are the two activities of his mind.

original: nang du yang dag 'jog gis bzhugs pa ni /
analyzed: nang du yang dag 'jog gis bzhugs pa ni /
translated: The activity of his mind is always in meditative equipoise, and so it is the activity of meditative concentration and meditative equipoise.

original: thugs rje chen pos 'jig rten la gzigs pa dang / lha la sogs pa 'ong ba ni nang du yang dag 'jog gis bzhugs pa'o zhes pa ni gdan de la bzhugs te /
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos 'jig rten la gzigs pa dang / lha la sogs pa 'ong ba ni nang du yang dag 'jog gis bzhugs pa'o zhes pa ni gdan de la bzhugs te /
translated: The activity of his mind is to look upon the world with great compassion, and the activity of his mind is to look upon the gods and so forth.

original: gzungs 'dis bdud btul nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa byed ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzungs 'dis bdud btul nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa byed ces pa'i don to //
translated: These are the meanings of the words “seated on that seat, he subdued Mara with this dharani and turned the wheel of the Dharma.”

original: bdud ji ltar btul na /
analyzed: bdud ji ltar btul na /
translated: How did he subdue Mara?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis srod la bdud btul nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis srod la bdud btul nas /
translated: The Bhagavan subdued Mara in the evening.

original: phyag g-yas pa lan gnyis su mnyam gzhag gi @254b phyag rgyab shig ste /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa lan gnyis su mnyam gzhag gi @254b phyag rgyab shig ste /
translated: He raised his right hand in the gesture of meditation twice.

original: lan cig bdud kyi dmag byung ste /
analyzed: lan cig bdud kyi dmag byung ste /
translated: Once, the army of Mara appeared.

original: phyag spyi bo la bskor bas ral gri me chen po mched /
analyzed: phyag spyi bo la bskor bas ral gri me chen po mched /
translated: He turned his hand over his head, and a great flaming sword

original: rab tu mched kun du mched pa cig tu bdud rnams kyis mthong ste bdud kyi dmag pham par byas so //
analyzed: rab tu mched kun du mched pa cig tu bdud rnams kyis mthong ste bdud kyi dmag pham par byas so //
translated: was seen by the Maras, and the army of Mara was defeated.

original: lan cig bdud kyis ngan smras byas nas /
analyzed: lan cig bdud kyis ngan smras byas nas /
translated: Once, Mara spoke evil words:

original: khyod yang dang par sangs rgyas ma yin zhing /
analyzed: khyod yang dang par sangs rgyas ma yin zhing /
translated: You are not a Buddha yet,

original: brdzun po'i sangs rgyas yin te /
analyzed: brdzun po'i sangs rgyas yin te /
translated: but a false Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas pa la bskal ba grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du tshogs rnam pa gnyis kyang bsags dgos la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la bskal ba grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du tshogs rnam pa gnyis kyang bsags dgos la /
translated: In order to become a Buddha, one must accumulate the two collections for three incalculable aeons,

original: sa bcu yang mthar phyin dgos so zer ro //
analyzed: sa bcu yang mthar phyin dgos so zer ro //
translated: and one must perfect the ten grounds.

original: de ltar byas so gsungs pas /
analyzed: de ltar byas so gsungs pas /
translated: So it is, he said.

original: 'o na khyod la che bzhi dang / dbang po su yod zer ;
analyzed: 'o na khyod la che bzhi dang / dbang po su yod zer ;
translated: Well then, who are your four great ones and your sense organs?

original: de'i tshe nga la che bzhi dang dbang po sa chen po 'di yod ces gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe nga la che bzhi dang dbang po sa chen po 'di yod ces gsungs te /
translated: At that time, my four great ones and my sense organs were this great earth.

original: phyag g-yas pas lan cig brdabs pas /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pas lan cig brdabs pas /
translated: He clapped his right hand once,

original: sa gseb nas sa'i lha mo sku lte ba yan chad 'thon te /
analyzed: sa gseb nas sa'i lha mo sku lte ba yan chad 'thon te /
translated: and from a crack in the earth the earth goddess emerged up to her navel.

original: bcom ldan 'das mad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mad do //
translated: She said, “Blessed One, you are right.

original: bde bar gshegs pa mad do //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa mad do //
translated: Sugata, you are right.

original: brdzun gyi sangs rgyas ma yin te /
analyzed: brdzun gyi sangs rgyas ma yin te /
translated: You are not a false buddha.

original: yang dag pa'i sangs rgyas yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sangs rgyas yin te /
translated: You are a true buddha.

original: sa chen po 'di'i steng du tshogs rnam pa gnyis kyang bsags so //
analyzed: sa chen po 'di'i steng du tshogs rnam pa gnyis kyang bsags so //
translated: You have gathered the two accumulations on the surface of this great earth.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du'o //
translated: You have done so for three incalculable eons.

original: sa bcu yang rim gyis bgrod de /
analyzed: sa bcu yang rim gyis bgrod de /
translated: You have also traversed the ten grounds in stages.

original: mthar phyin par byas zer ro //
analyzed: mthar phyin par byas zer ro //
translated: You have brought them to completion.”

original: des na bcom ldan 'das sa gnon gyi phyag rgya can cig bsam mo //
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das sa gnon gyi phyag rgya can cig bsam mo //
translated: Therefore, you should imagine the Blessed One with the earth-touching mudra.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes pa ni /
translated: “By the power of the Buddha” means

original: byin gyis rlabs kyis so //🔽lag na rdo rje zhes pa ni /
analyzed: byin gyis rlabs kyis so // lag na rdo rje zhes pa ni /
translated: by his blessing.🔽“Vajrapāṇi” means

original: lag na rdo rje thogs pas na lag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje thogs pas na lag na rdo rje'o //
translated: he holds a vajra in his hand, so he is Vajrapāṇi.

original: de yang ye shes rnam pa lnga gsang ba'i thig les 'dzin pas na lag na rdo rjer bshad do //
analyzed: de yang ye shes rnam pa lnga gsang ba'i thig les 'dzin pas na lag na rdo rjer bshad do //
translated: Moreover, he is explained as Vajrapāṇi because he holds the secret drop of the five aspects of pristine consciousness.

original: yang na lag na rdo rje zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na lag na rdo rje zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Alternatively, Vajrapāṇi is the name of the place where the empowerment was conferred.

original: kun tu bzang po la gsang ba dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba'i don du /🔽lho phyogs kyi grong khyer chen po ru /
analyzed: kun tu bzang po la gsang ba dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba'i don du / lho phyogs kyi grong khyer chen po ru /
translated: In order to confer the secret empowerment and the name empowerment on Samantabhadra,

original: rin po che sna tshogs las grub pa'i gzhal yas khang chen po cig mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: rin po che sna tshogs las grub pa'i gzhal yas khang chen po cig mngon par sprul te /
translated: Vajrapāṇi emanated a great celestial mansion made of various jewels in the great city in the south.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos /🔽phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang thabs cig tu mos te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos / phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang thabs cig tu mos te /
translated: Then Bhagavān Mahāvajradhara🔽was in union with all the tathāgatas of the ten directions.

original: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thams cad gcig tu bsdus te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thams cad gcig tu bsdus te /
translated: He gathered all the pristine consciousnesses of the tathāgatas of the ten directions into one.

original: ye shes kyi rdo rje rtse lnga pa gcig tu byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rdo rje rtse lnga pa gcig tu byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: He blessed it into a five-pointed vajra of pristine consciousness.

original: kun tu bzang po'i lag tu gtad pa tsam gyis gsang ba'i dbang thob ste /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs @255a * //
analyzed: kun tu bzang po'i lag tu gtad pa tsam gyis gsang ba'i dbang thob ste / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs @255a * //
translated: As soon as it was placed in the hand of Samantabhadra, he obtained the secret empowerment.

original: kyi gsang ba dpag tu med cing /
analyzed: kyi gsang ba dpag tu med cing /
translated: The secret of the body, speech, and mind of the tathāgatas is immeasurable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan mi dgos par dus gcig tu skad cig la rtogs pas gsang ba'i dbang thob bo //🔽de'i mod la brgya byin la sogs pa'i gnas su //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan mi dgos par dus gcig tu skad cig la rtogs pas gsang ba'i dbang thob bo // de'i mod la brgya byin la sogs pa'i gnas su //
translated: Since the inconceivable is taught, there is no need to realize it in a single instant, so the secret empowerment is obtained.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po ni phyag na rdo rje gyur te zhes bya ba'i sgra byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po ni phyag na rdo rje gyur te zhes bya ba'i sgra byung ste /
translated: At that very moment, the words “Bodhisattva Samantabhadra has become Vajrapāṇi” resounded in the realms of Indra and so on.

original: de'i mod la de rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: de'i mod la de rnams kyis kyang /
translated: At that very moment, they also

original: mchod pa'i tshogs chen po khyer nas 'ongs te /
analyzed: mchod pa'i tshogs chen po khyer nas 'ongs te /
translated: came, carrying a great collection of offerings,

original: mchod pa chen pos mchod do //
analyzed: mchod pa chen pos mchod do //
translated: and made offerings with great offerings.

original: des ni ming gi dbang thob pa'i rtags su lag tu rdo rje gtad pas kyang lag na rdo rje zhes bshad do //
analyzed: des ni ming gi dbang thob pa'i rtags su lag tu rdo rje gtad pas kyang lag na rdo rje zhes bshad do //
translated: Since that is the sign of obtaining the name empowerment, the vajra is placed in the hand, and therefore it is explained as “Vajrapāṇi.”

original: lus thams cad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus thams cad ces bya ba ni /
translated: “The entire body”

original: de'i dus na'o ;
analyzed: de'i dus na'o ;
translated: is at that time.

original: ; da ltar ni sgrub pa po'am las kyi lha rdo rje sems dpa' 'am /
analyzed: ; da ltar ni sgrub pa po'am las kyi lha rdo rje sems dpa' 'am /
translated: Now, the practitioner or the karma deity is Vajrasattva,

original: yi dam gyi lha gang yang rung ba rdo rjer byin gyis brlabs nas zhes pa ni stong pa nyid du byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: yi dam gyi lha gang yang rung ba rdo rjer byin gyis brlabs nas zhes pa ni stong pa nyid du byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: or any of the pledged deities, having been blessed as a vajra.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i lha bsgom mo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i lha bsgom mo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should meditate on the non-conceptual deity.

original: des ni cho ga yan lag drug gis bdag nyid lhar bskyed pa'i sngon du ji ltar byin gyis rlob pa'i gsol ba gdab pa'i thabs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des ni cho ga yan lag drug gis bdag nyid lhar bskyed pa'i sngon du ji ltar byin gyis rlob pa'i gsol ba gdab pa'i thabs bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the method of supplicating for the consecration, which precedes the generation of oneself as the deity by means of the six-branched yoga.

original: da ni bdag gi de kho na nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i lha bsgom pa'i zhar la 'byung bal dang ba'i thabs dang bcas pa bstan te /
analyzed: da ni bdag gi de kho na nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i lha bsgom pa'i zhar la 'byung bal dang ba'i thabs dang bcas pa bstan te /
translated: Now, the method of purifying, along with the method of faith, is taught in the context of meditating on the non-conceptual deity, one's own suchness.

original: de yang rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes gsungs te ;
analyzed: de yang rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes gsungs te ;
translated: And that is taught by entered into the vajra-samādhi.

original: zhes pa ni chos kyi sku stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos kyi sku stong pa nyid do //
translated: Dharmakāya is emptiness.

original: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Samādhi means

original: stong pa nyid kyi dmigs pa sems rtse gcig tu yang nas yang du gtod par byed pas ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi dmigs pa sems rtse gcig tu yang nas yang du gtod par byed pas ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: repeatedly directing the mind one-pointedly to the object of emptiness, thus it is samādhi.

original: rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Vajra-samādhi is taught

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin de la mngon par zhen pas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin de la mngon par zhen pas /
translated: because of strongly clinging to that samādhi of emptiness.

original: dbyer mi phyed pas rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: dbyer mi phyed pas rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: It is the vajra samādhi because it is indivisible.

original: yang na stong pa nyid dang bdag nyid kyi yang dbyer med pas na yang rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang na stong pa nyid dang bdag nyid kyi yang dbyer med pas na yang rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Or else, it is the vajra samādhi because it is indivisible from emptiness and the self.

original: de yang rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, the vajra samādhi is as follows.

original: bshad lugs dang po dang gnyis pa'i skabs su ni /
analyzed: bshad lugs dang po dang gnyis pa'i skabs su ni /
translated: In the context of the first and second explanations,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i lha bsgom pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i lha bsgom pa la bya'o //
translated: it refers to the meditation on the nonconceptual deity.

analyzed: h'um yig bltas te de 'phro 'du las khro bo'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa lte ba la h'um gis mtshan pa cig bsams la /

analyzed: de la dmigs pa rtse gcig tu yang nas yang du sems gtad nas /

analyzed: snyoms par zhugs so zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid sgom pa'i gnas skabs na /

analyzed: ma snyoms pa med de ; snyoms par gnas so //

analyzed: de nas rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes dgongs so //
translated: Then he entered into vajra meditative absorption.

original: de nas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni /
translated: Then means

analyzed: stong pa nyid bsgoms pa'i rjes de nas zhes pa'o //

original: lag na rdo rje zhes pa ni /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje zhes pa ni /

original: gong dang mthun no //🔽sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gong dang mthun no // sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes pa ni /
translated: is the same as above.🔽By the power of the Buddha

original: dngos su 'od zer ram ;🔽phyag gis reg pa'am /
analyzed: dngos su 'od zer ram ; phyag gis reg pa'am /
translated: means that he was empowered by the light rays,🔽the touch of the hand,

original: se gol gyi brdas blang ba'o //
analyzed: se gol gyi brdas blang ba'o //
translated: or the sound of the snap of the fingers.

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes pa ni /

analyzed: de gnyis ting nge 'dzin las snyoms par zhugs pa'i dbang ngam stobs kyis /
translated: means that by the power or strength of those two entering into meditative absorption,

analyzed: bdag nyid ting nge 'dzin las bslang pa'o //

analyzed: dper na sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid kyi bde ba la chags pas /

analyzed: sems can gyi don bya bar mi nus pas /

analyzed: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'od zer gyis bskul nas /

analyzed: stong pa nyid las bslang nas sems can gyi don byed du bcug pa bzhin no //

original: rdo rje khro bo zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje khro bo zhes pa ni /

analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la rdo rje khro bo zhes btags nas bshad do //

analyzed: 'o na stong pa nyid de la rdo rje khro bo zhes btags ba ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de ni de dang chos mthun pa yod de /
translated: There is a reason for that, because it is similar to that.

analyzed: 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'dra ba rgyu mtshan du byas nas /
translated: The reason for the designation is that, taking similarity as the reason,

analyzed: chos kyi sku stong pa nyid la rdo rje khro bo zhes bshad do //

analyzed: yang na khro bo rdo rje dngos la khro bo zhes bshad do //

analyzed: de yang dper na rdo rje rin po che pha lam des phar la ni rin po che thams cad 'bigs shing 'joms la tshur la ni gnod par mi nus pa dang / khro bo rdo rje gshin rje gshed la sogs pas kyang phar la ni dngos po dang mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'jig cing 'joms / tshur la ni gang gis kyang gnod par mi 'gyur ba bzhin du chos kyi sku stong pa nyid des kyang phar la dngos po dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i mtha' dang bdag dang gzhan gyi mtha' dang / rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin @256a * //
translated: And the wrathful ones such as Vajra Yamantaka destroy and annihilate all conceptual thoughts of entities and attributes.🔽And nothing can harm them.

original: pa'i mtha' dang / yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' thams cad 'jig cing 'joms la /
analyzed: pa'i mtha' dang / yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' thams cad 'jig cing 'joms la /
translated: In the same way, the dharmakaya of emptiness destroys and annihilates all the extremes of grasping at entities and attributes, the extremes of self and other, the extremes of eternalism and nihilism, the extremes of subject and object, and the extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: tshur la ni gang chos kyi stong pa nyid la gang gis kyang bshig cing 'joms par mi nus pas na rdo rje khro bo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: tshur la ni gang chos kyi stong pa nyid la gang gis kyang bshig cing 'joms par mi nus pas na rdo rje khro bo zhes bshad do //

original: de yang bshad lugs dang po'i skabs su /
analyzed: de yang bshad lugs dang po'i skabs su /

analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la rdo rje khro bo zhes bshad do //

analyzed: bar ba'i skabs su thugs mtshan rdo rje khro bo zhes bshad do //

original: bshad lugs tha ma'i skabs su ni /
analyzed: bshad lugs tha ma'i skabs su ni /

analyzed: khro bo'i rdo rje rtse gcig pa bsams la / rdo rje khro bo zhes bshad do //
translated: one imagines a single-pointed wrathful vajra.

original: las byung ba zhes pa ni dang po'i skabs su /
analyzed: las byung ba zhes pa ni dang po'i skabs su /
translated: In the first section, arisen from action refers to

analyzed: de kho na nyid bsre ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: snga ma'i stong pa nyid la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems las /

analyzed: stong pa nyid spyod pa dang bcas pa'i sems bdag dang lha'i de kho na nyid bsre ba'i sems phyi ma byung ba'o //
translated: The latter is the mind of mixing one's own reality with the deity's reality, which is the mind with the practice of emptiness.

original: bar ba'i skabs su sgra'i lha bsgom pa la sogs pa byung ba'o //
analyzed: bar ba'i skabs su sgra'i lha bsgom pa la sogs pa byung ba'o //
translated: In the middle section, the meditation on the sound deity and so forth occurs.

analyzed: tha ma'i skabs su bdag nyid kyis rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas nye bar len pa'i rgyu byas nas /
translated: In the latter section, having served as the substantial cause by entering into the vajra absorption oneself,

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen byas te khro bo rdo rje lte ba'i yi ge las /

analyzed: des na bdag gi de kho na nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i lha bsgom pa /

analyzed: ldang ba'i thabs dang bcas pa bshad zin to /

analyzed: lha drug gi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa gang thob pa bstan te /

analyzed: rdo rje ni stong pa nyid do //

analyzed: yang na snying po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Alternatively, heart is

analyzed: khro bo'i skur sprul nas kyang 'dul bar byed do //

original: de yang rgyud las /

analyzed: khro bor de bzhin gshegs kun mdzad // ces gsungs so //
translated: It is the supreme because it is the supreme of all the paths.🔽It is the supreme because it is the supreme of all the mandalas.

original: yang na mchog tu gyur pa ni /
analyzed: yang na mchog tu gyur pa ni /
translated: It is the supreme because it is the supreme of all the initiations.🔽It is the supreme because it is the supreme of all the mudras.🔽It is the supreme because it is the supreme of all the mantras.

analyzed: rig sngags dang gsang sngags gzhan kho na las mchog tu gyur te /

analyzed: rdo rje'i chos bdun ni mi chod par bya ba nas /

translated: The four actions are

analyzed: drag po dang / dbang dang / rgyas pa dang / zhi ba'o //

analyzed: gdon thams cad rlag par byed pa bya ba'i bar du tshig rkang brgyad kyis bstan to //

analyzed: rig sngags kyi las thams cad byed du 'jug pa zhes pa'i tshig rkang gnyis bstan to //

analyzed: rgyas pa'i mdzad pa @257a * //

analyzed: ni ; ma grub pa thams cad grub par byed pa bya ba nas /

translated: The generation of the form of the deity is taught.🔽🔽This has been explained.🔽🔽Again, it is objected that according to the general tantras of the mantra vehicle,🔽the cultivation of the deity's body is taught to be a fault.🔽🔽The recitation of the mantra is taught.🔽🔽But in this dhāraṇī, after the cultivation of the deity's body,🔽the recitation of the mantra is not taught.🔽🔽What is the intention of teaching the emanation and re-absorption of light rays, the recitation of the mantra, and the person for whom the approach and accomplishment are performed?🔽🔽Thus, the intention of the dhāraṇī🔽is that the emanation and re-absorption of light rays are also done for the sake of these persons whose faculties are impaired, and the emanation and re-absorption of light rays and the accomplishment of the approach are done for the sake of these very persons.🔽🔽Therefore, after the teaching of the cultivation of the deity's body,🔽

analyzed: gza' dang zhes pa ni gza' chen po r'a hu la la sogs pa brgyad do //

analyzed: rgyu skar zhes pa ni smin drug la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad do //
translated: As for constellations, they are the twenty-eight such as Mṛgaśiras.

original: gza' skar ngan pa la na ba dang / shi ba dang / skyes pa la sogs pa byung na /
analyzed: gza' skar ngan pa la na ba dang / shi ba dang / skyes pa la sogs pa byung na /

original: yang 'di'i cho ga byas na nges par zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang 'di'i cho ga byas na nges par zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if this rite is performed, it will certainly be pacified.

original: byang stems dang zhes pa ni //
analyzed: byang stems dang zhes pa ni //
translated: As for bodhisattva,

analyzed: 'khrul 'khor la sogs par bdag gi ming rus la sogs pa bcug pa'am /
translated: Or one should put one's name and family, etc. into a magic circle, etc.

original: mi bzad gdon gyi zhes pa ni lha'i gdon la sogs pa gdon chen po bco brgyad las dge slong dang / rgyal po la 'dzin pa'i srin po'i gdon la sogs pa'i gdon chen po bzhi'o //
analyzed: mi bzad gdon gyi zhes pa ni lha'i gdon la sogs pa gdon chen po bco brgyad las dge slong dang / rgyal po la 'dzin pa'i srin po'i gdon la sogs pa'i gdon chen po bzhi'o //
translated: The unbearable demons are the four great demons, such as the demon that seizes monks and kings, from among the eighteen great demons, such as the demon of the gods.

original: nyan pa zhes pa ni //🔽sems can gyi lus sam /
analyzed: nyan pa zhes pa ni // sems can gyi lus sam /
translated: The listeners are🔽the demons that enter the bodies of sentient beings,

original: sems la zhugs pa'i //🔽mya ngan ngal nas byung ba yi //
analyzed: sems la zhugs pa'i // mya ngan ngal nas byung ba yi //
translated: or their minds.

original: rmi lam sdig pa mthong na yang //
analyzed: rmi lam sdig pa mthong na yang //
translated: When one sees evil in a dream that arises from sorrow and fatigue,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: one should recite this mantra.

original: gang gi rang gi rmi lam du byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi rang gi rmi lam du byung ba ste /

analyzed: rmi ltas ngan pa sum cu rtsa gnyis po gang byung yang 'di'i cho ga byas na bzlog go //
translated: if one performs this rite, it will be averted, even if any of the thirty-two evil dream omens occur.

analyzed: sdig pa mthong na yang zhes pa bka' mi shis pa'i mtshan ma la sogs @265b pa mthong ba'o //

original: de tsho gang byung yang bzlas brjod byas pas sgo nas /
analyzed: de tsho gang byung yang bzlas brjod byas pas sgo nas /
translated: Whatever of those occurs, by performing the rite of recitation,

original: 'od zer spro bsdu dang / khrus kyi cho ga byas pas /
analyzed: 'od zer spro bsdu dang / khrus kyi cho ga byas pas /
translated: through the emanation and reabsorption of light rays and the rite of bathing,

original: de dag thams cad la grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad la grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be liberated from all of them.

original: des ni bsnyen sgrub gang gi don du bya ba'i gdul bya bstan to //
analyzed: des ni bsnyen sgrub gang gi don du bya ba'i gdul bya bstan to //

analyzed: da ni bsnyen pa'i dus na sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan bstan te /
translated: Now, the meditative concentration abiding in sound at the time of approach is taught.

original: de la gsum /
analyzed: de la gsum /

analyzed: sbyor ba'i cho ga sngon du bya ba dang / sgra la gnas pa'i sbam gtan dngos dang / de bya ba'i phan yon no //
translated: the preliminary ritual of the yoga, the actual meditative concentration abiding in sound, and the benefits of performing that.

original: dang po ni /
analyzed: dang po ni /
translated: The first is

analyzed: de ni rab bkrus gtsang ma yin //

analyzed: bya ba dang / gang dag yid dge sems dang zhing //

analyzed: gtsang ma'i gos kyis rab brgyan te //

original: bya ba'i tshig rkang gsum gyis so /
analyzed: bya ba'i tshig rkang gsum gyis so /

original: mdo sde dam pa mnyam par bya //
analyzed: mdo sde dam pa mnyam par bya //
translated: One should be impartial toward the sublime sūtras,

original: zab mo sangs rgyas spyod yul ba /
analyzed: zab mo sangs rgyas spyod yul ba /
translated: the profound domain of the buddhas.

original: mdo sde'i 'di ni byan byed na //
analyzed: mdo sde'i 'di ni byan byed na //
translated: If one recites this sūtra,

analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig rkang gsum gyi ni dngos gzhi bstan to //

analyzed: mdo sde 'di yi gzi brjid kyis // zhes pa nas //
translated: By the splendor of this sūtra,

original: sdig ba kun las rnam par thar //
analyzed: sdig ba kun las rnam par thar //

analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig rkang bdun gyi phan yon bstan to //
translated: The benefits of the seven lines are taught.

original: sngon du bya ba ni //
analyzed: sngon du bya ba ni //
translated: The preliminaries are

original: de yang su siddhi ka ra las //
analyzed: de yang su siddhi ka ra las //
translated: also taught in the Siddhāṅka:🔽Purity of body and speech,

analyzed: lus dang ngag gi gtsang sbra dang / gsum pa yid kyi gtsang sbra ste //

analyzed: bzhi pa bden par smra ba'o // lnga pa phyi yi gtsang sbrar bshad //

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: and fifth, external purity is explained.

original: des ni zhes pas ni sgrub pa po bstan to ;
analyzed: des ni zhes pas ni sgrub pa po bstan to ;
translated: By this, the practitioner is taught.

original: rab bkrus zhes pa ni //
analyzed: rab bkrus zhes pa ni //
translated: Well-washed

original: phyi'i gtsang sbra ste /
analyzed: phyi'i gtsang sbra ste /
translated: is the external purity.🔽From washing with earth and water, sprinkling, rinsing,

analyzed: sa dang chu'i khrus dang / 'thor 'thung nye reg gi bar du // gtsang ma zhes pa ni //
translated: up to🔽pure

analyzed: mi gtsang ba dag pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: is the state of being purified from impurities.

original: yid ces pa ni //
analyzed: yid ces pa ni //
translated: Mind

analyzed: dag par byas nas sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that having purified, one should practice concentration on sound.

analyzed: 'dis mtshon te / cho ga yan lag drug gis lha bskyed pa'i sngon du yang /
translated: This is illustrated🔽by the six-branched yoga.

analyzed: khrus dang gtsang sbra la sogs pa bya'o //

analyzed: gang dag yid dge zhes pa ni yid ches pa'i dad pas kun nas bslangs nas /
translated: Those who have a virtuous mind means that, having been motivated by the faith of conviction,

analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas sdig pa mi dge ba mi byed pa'o //

analyzed: sems dang zhing zhes pa ni //

analyzed: dad pa rnams gsum las dang ba'i dad pa ste /

analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sems nyon mongs pa'i rnyog ma dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: One's own mind is not mixed with the turbidity of the afflictions.

analyzed: gtsang ma'i gos zhes pa ni sngags pas thang gos dkar la shin tu 'jam pa la /
translated: The pure garment means that the mantrin, on white cloth that is very soft,

analyzed: dus gsum du bkru ba dang / yang gu gul gyi dud pas bdug cing sngags bzlas so //
translated: bathes three times a day, and also fumigates it with gugul incense while reciting the mantra.

original: yang na bsang gtor @266a * //
analyzed: yang na bsang gtor @266a * //
translated: Or else, one should perform a burnt offering.

original: bya'o ; / de yang su siddhi ka ra las //
analyzed: bya'o ; / de yang su siddhi ka ra las //
translated: Moreover, it is stated in the Śālistambha-sūtra:

original: sngags pas thang gos mi spang zhing //
analyzed: sngags pas thang gos mi spang zhing //
translated: The mantrin should not abandon the white cloth,

original: dkar la shin tu 'jam po de //
analyzed: dkar la shin tu 'jam po de //
translated: which is soft and very white.

original: nyin gcig bzhin du bsang bar bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyin gcig bzhin du bsang bar bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: One should fumigate it every day.

original: rab brgyan te zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rab brgyan te zhes pa ni /
translated: Well adorned means

analyzed: sngags gos kyis sngags pa shin tu mdzes par byas pa'o //
translated: that the mantrin is made very beautiful by the mantra cloth.

analyzed: sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba'i cho ga'i sngon du bya ba bshad zin to /
translated: The preliminaries for the procedure of the concentration which is based on sound have been explained.

original: // / da ni sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i cho ga dngos bstan te /
analyzed: // / da ni sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i cho ga dngos bstan te /
translated: Now, the actual procedure of the concentration which is based on sound will be taught.

original: mdo sde zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mdo sde zhes pa ni /
translated: The sutra is

analyzed: mtshan nyid mdor bsdus nas bstan du rung ba dang / gnyen po rnam par 'gal ba'i sgo nas spong pas na mdo sde'o //
translated: the sutra because it is suitable to be taught in brief by means of the characteristics, and because it is abandoned by means of the antidote in the manner of a complete contradiction.

original: dam zhes pa ni ;🔽bskyed rim gsum ka bya bar 'thad pas na /
analyzed: dam zhes pa ni ; bskyed rim gsum ka bya bar 'thad pas na /
translated: The holy is

analyzed: dam pa zhes gsungs so // yang na mtshan nyid kyi theg pa las mchog tu gyur pas na /
translated: the holy because it is suitable to be performed by all three of the generation stages.

original: dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, it is called the holy because it is supreme in comparison to the vehicle of characteristics.

original: ji ltar mchog tu gyur nas mtshan nyid kyi theg pas khrus dang gtsang sbra dang / dka' thub la sogs pa'i sgo nas dngos grub bsgrubs kyang tshe 'di la mkha' spyod kyi dngos grub la sogs pa mi thob la /

translated: How is it supreme? In the vehicle of characteristics, even though one strives for spiritual powers by means of ablutions, purity, austerities, and so on, one does not obtain the spiritual powers of Khecara in this life.

analyzed: gzungs 'dis ni tshe 'di la mkha' spyod la sogs pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur bas na /
translated: By means of this dhāraṇī, one will attain the siddhis of Khecarī and so on in this very life.🔽

analyzed: dam pa zhes gsungs so // mnyan par bya zhes pa ni ngag gi brjod bya rjod byed kyi tshig spangs te /
translated: This dhāraṇī is called excellent because by it one attains the powers of space-travel and so forth in this very life.

original: bdag nyid kyi sems sgra spyi'i rnam par snang ba'o //🔽zab mo zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sems sgra spyi'i rnam par snang ba'o // zab mo zhes pa ni /
translated: Listening means abandoning the words that are the expressed meaning of speech, and the expression that is the means of expression, and [means] the appearance of one's own mind in the aspect of general sound.

original: sgrub pa po'i sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan byed pa de /
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan byed pa de /
translated: Profound means that the meditation of the practitioner who abides in sound

analyzed: tha mal pa'i so so'i skye bos mi rtogs pas na zab mo zhes pa'o //
translated: is not realized by ordinary, common beings, and therefore it is called profound.

original: 'o na sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan te sus rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'o na sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan te sus rtogs she na /
translated: Well then, who realizes the meditation that abides in sound?

original: sangs rgyas spyod yul pa zhes pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas spyod yul pa zhes pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said the domain of the buddhas.

analyzed: sangs rgyas nyag gcig kho na'i spyod yul yin pas des mkhyen to //
translated: Since it is the domain of only the buddhas, it is known by them.

original: mdo sde 'di ni nyan byed na //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di ni nyan byed na //
translated: If one listens to this sūtra,

original: zhes pa ni sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan 'di byed na zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan 'di byed na zhes pa'i don to //
translated: it means that if one performs this meditation that abides in sound.

original: sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan gyi mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
analyzed: sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan gyi mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
translated: The definition of the meditation that abides in sound has been explained.

original: // / da ni sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan gyi phan yon bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan gyi phan yon bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the benefits of concentration abiding in sound should be explained.

original: mdo sde 'di yi gzi brjid kyis //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di yi gzi brjid kyis //
translated: By the splendor of this sutra,

analyzed: zhes pa ni sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan gyi phan yon gyis zhes pa'i don to //
translated: means the benefit of concentration abiding in sound.

original: srog chags dag ni thams cad kyi //
analyzed: srog chags dag ni thams cad kyi //
translated: All the living beings

original: zhes pa ni 'gro ba'i ris lnga'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'gro ba'i ris lnga'o //

original: mi bzad pa yi nad rnams kun //
analyzed: mi bzad pa yi nad rnams kun //
translated: All the terrible diseases

original: zhes pa ni mdze'i nad la @266b sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mdze'i nad la @266b sogs pa'o //
translated: means leprosy and so forth.

original: de dag thams cad zhi bar blta //
analyzed: de dag thams cad zhi bar blta //
translated: All of them should be seen as pacified

analyzed: zhes pa ni mi bzad pa'i nad chen po las thar bar byed ces pa'i don to //
translated: means that it has the meaning of being liberated from terrible, great disease.

analyzed: tshe dang bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur //

analyzed: zhes pa ni sngon gyi rnam par smin pa las tshe slar nur te ring por thub pa'o //
translated: means that by the former ripening, life is extended and one lives long.

original: dper na bcud len gyi sman sbyor lta bu'o /
analyzed: dper na bcud len gyi sman sbyor lta bu'o /
translated: For example, it is like the preparation of an elixir.

original: bsod nams 'phel par 'gyur zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bsod nams 'phel par 'gyur zhes pa ni /
translated: Merit will increase

analyzed: bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: means that all of one's own perfections will increase.

analyzed: bris nas 'dzin tam / 'chang ngam / klog gam /
translated: and having written it out, holds it,🔽or bears it in mind, or reads it aloud,

analyzed: kun chub par byed pa la sogs pa byas nas /
translated: or masters it, and so on,🔽and having made offerings to it with flowers, etc.,

analyzed: me tog la sogs pas mchod pa dang / rim gro la sogs pa byas na /
translated: and having rendered service, etc.,

analyzed: de dang de'i bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur ba lta bu'am / sa chen po la sa bon btab nas rgyu rkyen tshogs par gyur nas /

original: rnam par 'phel par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'phel par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: they will grow.

original: sdig pa kun las rnam par thar /
analyzed: sdig pa kun las rnam par thar /
translated: Liberated from all evil

analyzed: zhes pa ni yid du mi 'ong ba thams cad mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: means that nothing unpleasant occurs.

original: yang na mi dge ba bcu dang / las kyi sgrib pa gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ba thams cad spangs pa'o //🔽dper na mi dge ba bcu spangs nas /
analyzed: yang na mi dge ba bcu dang / las kyi sgrib pa gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ba thams cad spangs pa'o // dper na mi dge ba bcu spangs nas /

original: dge ba bcu spyod pa'i gang zag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge ba bcu spyod pa'i gang zag lta bu'o //
translated: and practices the ten virtues.

original: sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan bya bar 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to perform the concentration abiding in sound,

original: bsam gtan phyi ma las kyang /
analyzed: bsam gtan phyi ma las kyang /
translated: in the Later Tantra of Concentration🔽it is said:

original: gsang sngags la gnas dngos grub ster //
analyzed: gsang sngags la gnas dngos grub ster //

original: sgra gnas rnal 'byor ster bar dran //
analyzed: sgra gnas rnal 'byor ster bar dran //
translated: The granting of the yoga is remembered as abiding in sound.

original: sgra mthar thar pa ster ba nyid //
analyzed: sgra mthar thar pa ster ba nyid //

original: 'di dag de nyid gsum pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag de nyid gsum pa yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: These are the three realities.

original: sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan ni //
analyzed: sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan ni //
translated: The concentration abiding in sound

analyzed: bdag nyid lhar bskyed pa mi dmigs par bsams la bde ba'i rjes la /

original: bdag nyid kyi sems stong pa nyid kyi ngang las /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sems stong pa nyid kyi ngang las /
translated: one's mind is in the state of emptiness.

original: nam mkha' las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng na /
analyzed: nam mkha' las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng na /
translated: From space, on a moon mandala,

original: gzungs sngags la sogs pa dkar sha re yod par bsams la /
analyzed: gzungs sngags la sogs pa dkar sha re yod par bsams la /

original: yi ge de'i 'od zer me 'bar ba lta bur bsams te /
analyzed: yi ge de'i 'od zer me 'bar ba lta bur bsams te /

original: phyi nas de tshe yang mi dmigs par bsams le /
analyzed: phyi nas de tshe yang mi dmigs par bsams le /

original: bdag nyid kyi sems na mo ratna tra y'a ya bya ba nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sems na mo ratna tra y'a ya bya ba nas /
translated: One's mind is namo ratna trayāya.

original: aa mri te h'um phat bya ba'i bar du yi ge'i rang sgra sgrogs pa de yang dper na dril bu'i sgra dang 'dra bar rgyun mi 'chad par bdag nyid kyi sems sgra spyi yi rnam par grag par bsam @267a * //
analyzed: aa mri te h'um phat bya ba'i bar du yi ge'i rang sgra sgrogs pa de yang dper na dril bu'i sgra dang 'dra bar rgyun mi 'chad par bdag nyid kyi sems sgra spyi yi rnam par grag par bsam @267a * //
translated: The sound of the syllables, from a to amṛte hūṃ phaṭ, resounds like the sound of a bell. One should think that the sound of one’s mind resounds in the form of a general sound.

original: mo ; / de ni sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: mo ; / de ni sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: This is the meditative stabilization that is based on sound.

original: de mi byed na dmigs pa gsum gyis bya ba'am /
analyzed: de mi byed na dmigs pa gsum gyis bya ba'am /
translated: If one does not do that, one should do it with three objects of meditation,

original: yan lag bzhis bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag bzhis bya ste /
translated: or with four branches.

original: dmigs pa gsum ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa gsum ni /
translated: The three objects of meditation are stated in the Later Tantra:

original: sgra dang sems dang gzhi la gzhol //
analyzed: sgra dang sems dang gzhi la gzhol //

original: gsang sngags yi ge bzhi la gnas //🔽zhes bsam gtan phyi ma las gsungs so //
analyzed: gsang sngags yi ge bzhi la gnas // zhes bsam gtan phyi ma las gsungs so //
translated: One is based on the four syllables of the mantra.

original: gsang sngags kyi yi ge dang / de'i gdan zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi yi ge dang / de'i gdan zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'o //
translated: The four syllables of the mantra are the syllables of the mantra, the moon maṇḍala that is its seat, and the body of the Tathāgata.

original: dang po ni gzugs la dmigs /
analyzed: dang po ni gzugs la dmigs /
translated: The first is the object of meditation on form.

original: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la dmigs /
analyzed: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la dmigs /

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la dmigs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la dmigs so //
translated: Then one focuses on the Bhagavat.

original: yan lag bzhi ni /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi ni /
translated: The four branches are

original: bcom ldan 'das bum pa'i nang na bzhugs pa dang / bdag nyid lha ru bskyed pa dang / de gnyis kyi thugs ka na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor re re yod pa dang / de'i steng na gzungs rings sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bum pa'i nang na bzhugs pa dang / bdag nyid lha ru bskyed pa dang / de gnyis kyi thugs ka na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor re re yod pa dang / de'i steng na gzungs rings sam /
translated: and on top of that is the dhāraṇī,

original: yang snying ngam /
analyzed: yang snying ngam /
translated: or the essence mantra,

original: rigs kyi snying po gang rung gnas par bsam mo //
analyzed: rigs kyi snying po gang rung gnas par bsam mo //
translated: or the essence of the family, whichever is appropriate.

original: 'o na lha ni gnyis su bshad la /
analyzed: 'o na lha ni gnyis su bshad la /
translated: Now, if it is explained that there are two deities,

original: sngags dang / zla ba gnyis gnyis su mi 'chad pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sngags dang / zla ba gnyis gnyis su mi 'chad pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why are the two, the mantra and the moon, not explained as two?

original: nang du bsdus tsam na gsum las med pas de ru yang 'dra gsung ngo //
analyzed: nang du bsdus tsam na gsum las med pas de ru yang 'dra gsung ngo //
translated: When it is merely summarized, there are not more than three, so it is the same there.

original: yang na gsang sngags dang bzlas pa gnyis ni rigs mi mthun par yang rnam par bcad pa'i ldog pa mtshungs la lha ni mi mtshungs pa yang srid pas na lha la gsum du bshad pa /
analyzed: yang na gsang sngags dang bzlas pa gnyis ni rigs mi mthun par yang rnam par bcad pa'i ldog pa mtshungs la lha ni mi mtshungs pa yang srid pas na lha la gsum du bshad pa /
translated: Or, since the two, the secret mantra and the recitation, are similar in being the same exclusion negation, and it is possible that the deity is not the same, the deity is explained as three.

original: sngags dang zla ba gnyis la rigs 'dra bas re rer ma bshad do //
analyzed: sngags dang zla ba gnyis la rigs 'dra bas re rer ma bshad do //
translated: Since the two, the mantra and the moon, are similar in type, they are not explained as one.

original: bzlas brjod byed pa'i zlos lugs ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bzlas brjod byed pa'i zlos lugs ni gnyis te /

original: rdo rje'i tshig gam /
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig gam /

analyzed: shu bu'i sbyor bas ha cang mi dal mi myur bar sngags kyi yi ge brjod cing bzlas brjod bya'o //

analyzed: de gnyis kyi grangs ni gtso 'khor yod na gtso bo la 'bum phrag gcig /'khor rnams la khri phrag re re bya'o //
translated: As for the number of those two, if there is a principal deity and retinue, one should do one hundred thousand for the principal deity and ten thousand for each of the retinue.

original: yi ge'i grangs kyis byed na /
analyzed: yi ge'i grangs kyis byed na /
translated: If one does it by the number of syllables,

original: bco lnga man chad kyi yi ge re re zhing 'bum phrag re re bya'o //
analyzed: bco lnga man chad kyi yi ge re re zhing 'bum phrag re re bya'o //

original: bcu drug yan chad nas /
analyzed: bcu drug yan chad nas /
translated: For sixteen and above

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis man chad la ni 'bum phrag gsum bya'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis man chad la ni 'bum phrag gsum bya'o //
translated: up to thirty-two, one should do three hundred thousand.

original: de yan chad la ni 'bum phrag gsum bya'o gsung ngo //
analyzed: de yan chad la ni 'bum phrag gsum bya'o gsung ngo //
translated: For more than that, one should do one million.

original: 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa /
analyzed: 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa /
translated: Here, the Bhagavān Vajravidāraṇa

original: sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan la mchog tu brnyes pa //
analyzed: sgra la gnas pa'i bsam gtan la mchog tu brnyes pa //
translated: has attained the supreme concentration abiding in sound.

original: bsnyen pa'i dus su de bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen pa'i dus su de bya'o //
translated: One should do that during the approach.

original: bum pa la byed na gcig bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa la byed na gcig bya'o //
translated: If one is doing it for the vase, one should do one.

original: bsnyen pa dang sgrub pa'i bar du bzlas brjod byed pa ni gnyis ka'i shes par @267b bya'o ;
analyzed: bsnyen pa dang sgrub pa'i bar du bzlas brjod byed pa ni gnyis ka'i shes par @267b bya'o ;
translated: One should understand that the recitation between the approach and the accomplishment is for both.

original: / da ni sgrub pa'i cho ga bstan te /
analyzed: / da ni sgrub pa'i cho ga bstan te /
translated: Now, the ritual of the accomplishment is taught.

original: 'o na sgrub pa'i lugs kyis dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga dgos pa yin na bye brag gi rgyud 'di ru dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga mi ston pa ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sgrub pa'i lugs kyis dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga dgos pa yin na bye brag gi rgyud 'di ru dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga mi ston pa ci'i slad du zhe na /

original: bum pa'i cho ga ni dkyil 'khor la rag las pa yin pas /
analyzed: bum pa'i cho ga ni dkyil 'khor la rag las pa yin pas /

original: de bstan pas dkyil 'khor yang shugs kyis shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bstan pas dkyil 'khor yang shugs kyis shes pa yin no //
translated: and by teaching that, the mandala is also understood by implication.

analyzed: bum pa'i cho ga dkyil 'khor la rag las par ni dpung bzangs kyi rgyud las gsungs te /
translated: The Tantra of Good Protection teaches that the ritual of the vase is dependent on the mandala:

analyzed: dkyil 'khor khor yug bum pa gzhag par bya //
translated: “The vase should be placed in the periphery of the mandala.”

analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / bum pa brgyad yod na bum pa sgo bzhi'i logs su gzhag pa dang / bcu gnyis yod na zur bzhir yang gzhag gsung ngo //
translated: If there are eight vases, they should be placed at the sides of the four doors, and if there are twelve, they should be placed at the four corners.

original: gsang ba spyi rgyud las kyang /
analyzed: gsang ba spyi rgyud las kyang /

original: grva dang sgo ni ma lus par /
analyzed: grva dang sgo ni ma lus par /
translated: In the corners and all the doors

original: bum pa dag kyang bzhag nas ni //
analyzed: bum pa dag kyang bzhag nas ni //
translated: one should place the vases.🔽Two great intermediate doors

original: bar sgo chen po gnyis gnyis shig / khyad par du ni gzhag par bya //🔽bum pa gcig ni phyi sgo yi //
analyzed: bar sgo chen po gnyis gnyis shig / khyad par du ni gzhag par bya // bum pa gcig ni phyi sgo yi //
translated: should be placed in particular.🔽One vase should be placed

original: drung du mngon par gzhag par bya //
analyzed: drung du mngon par gzhag par bya //
translated: in front of the outer door.

original: zhes gsungs so ;🔽/'o na 'di ru dkyil 'khor bstan la /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so ; /'o na 'di ru dkyil 'khor bstan la /
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: bum pa'i cho ga spyi rgyud du kha mi bskang pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa'i cho ga spyi rgyud du kha mi bskang pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Now, if the maṇḍala is taught here, why is the vase ritual not completed in the general tantra?

original: de ni mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dra ste /

analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga dang bri ba tsam du khyad med la /

analyzed: bum pa'i cho ga la ni bye brag yod pas / rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa'i bum pa'i rdzas thun mong ma yin pa dgos te /

analyzed: yungs kar dang / rtsva d'ur ba dang / rdo rje pha lam dang / me tog dmar po'i phreng ba rnams so //

analyzed: des na dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga la ni khyad par med pas 'dir ma gsungs te /

original: rdo rje rigs kyi spyi rgyud las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi spyi rgyud las shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood from the Vajra Family's General Tantra.

original: bum pa'i cho ga la ni bye brag yod pas 'dir gsungs so //
analyzed: bum pa'i cho ga la ni bye brag yod pas 'dir gsungs so //

analyzed: des na dkyil 'khor 'dir ma bstan pa la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in not teaching it in this mandala.

analyzed: da ni sgrub pa'i dub na bum pa'i mtshan nyid bzlas brjod kyi grangs nges par khrus bya ba dang bcas pa bstan pa la gsum ste /

analyzed: bum pa rdzas dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / de la bzlas brjod ji ltar bya ba'i grangs bstan pa dang / gdul bya nye bar mtshon pa dang bcas par bstan pa'o //
translated: teaching the characteristics of the vase together with the substances, teaching the number of recitations to be done on it, and teaching it together with the indication of the disciples.

analyzed: de la dang por bum pa'i mtshan nyid bshad de /

original: nor bu zhes pa ni spyi'i ming du smos te /
analyzed: nor bu zhes pa ni spyi'i ming du smos te /

analyzed: bye brag du ma phyi ba dang / aindra n'i la dang / padma r'a ga la sogs pa'o //
translated: There are many specific types, such as crystal, sapphire, ruby, and so on.

analyzed: yungs kar @268a * //
translated: Mustard seeds are

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /

analyzed: yungs kar blugs pa'i snod gtsang ma 'jog pa'i don to //

analyzed: yungs kar de rnams kyang rdo rje rtse gcig par bsam pa'am /

translated: The turban is a knot tied in the nose of a cow that is bound with a rope of cow dung, and on top of that seven strands of turban grass are placed.

original: bgegs la sogs pa mi 'jug pa'i don du'o //🔽rin chen zhes pa ni //
analyzed: bgegs la sogs pa mi 'jug pa'i don du'o // rin chen zhes pa ni //
translated: The purpose of this is to prevent the entry of obstructors and so forth.🔽The jewels are

original: rin po che lnga ste /
analyzed: rin po che lnga ste /

analyzed: nor bu rin po che dang / byi ru dang ; gser sa le sbram dang / mu tig dang / shel lo //
translated: They are the precious gem, coral, refined gold, pearl, and crystal.

analyzed: rma med ces pa ni gas chags med cing rgyan gyi bya ba byed nus pa'o //
translated: The flawless means without cracks and able to perform the function of an ornament.

original: tsandan zhes pa ni dri lnga ste tsandan dang / ga pur dang / gur kum dang / dz'a ti pha la dang / gla rtsi yang bla ma na re gzhug gsung //
analyzed: tsandan zhes pa ni dri lnga ste tsandan dang / ga pur dang / gur kum dang / dz'a ti pha la dang / gla rtsi yang bla ma na re gzhug gsung //
translated: Sandalwood refers to the five scents: sandalwood, camphor, saffron, nutmeg, and musk.

original: kri ya las ni /🔽srog chags yan lag 'byung mi shis //
analyzed: kri ya las ni / srog chags yan lag 'byung mi shis //
translated: The Kriya Tantra states:

analyzed: zhes gsungs so // klu gnod na gla rtsi bcug na nus pa 'byung gsung ngo //
translated: “Do not use the parts of living beings.”

original: bcas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bcas zhes pa ni /

analyzed: sman lnga dang / 'bru lnga dang / snying po lnga bsdus te /
translated: The “and so forth” refers to the five medicines, the five grains, and the five essences.

original: sman lnga ni /
analyzed: sman lnga ni /

analyzed: 'bru lnga ni /

analyzed: 'bras kyi so ba dang / mon sran gre'u dang / nas dang / gro dang / til dang lnga'o //

analyzed: snying po lnga ni //

translated: The essence of the earth is sesame, the essence of water is salt, the essence of fruit is oil, the essence of wood is sugar, and the essence of flowers is honey.

original: shel dang zhes pa ni dngos so //
analyzed: shel dang zhes pa ni dngos so //
translated: Crystal is the actual thing.🔽Vajra means

original: rdo rje zhes pa ni /🔽rin po che pha lam mo //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes pa ni / rin po che pha lam mo //
translated: diamond.

original: de med na shel kun nas lci ma gzhog zur brgyad pa cig gzhug gsung ngo //
analyzed: de med na shel kun nas lci ma gzhog zur brgyad pa cig gzhug gsung ngo //
translated: If that is not available, it is said that one should place a crystal that is heavy all the way through and has eight facets.

analyzed: me tog ces pa ni me tog dmar po dri zhim po la phreng ba byas la bum pa'i mgul la brgyan par bya'o //

analyzed: chu yis zhes pa ni blangs pa'i chu gtsang ma srog chags med pas dgang ba'o //

original: dri zhim po'i chu yang blug go //
analyzed: dri zhim po'i chu yang blug go //

original: gser ram yang na ni /
analyzed: gser ram yang na ni /

analyzed: dngul gyi bum pa zhes pa ni bum pa'i rgyu bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the material of the vase.

original: tshad la sogs pa ni khrus kyi cho gar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: tshad la sogs pa ni khrus kyi cho gar shes par bya'o //
translated: The measurements and so forth should be understood from the ablution ritual.

analyzed: dag ces pa ni zangs la sogs pa bstan to //

analyzed: kyang zhes pa ni bsdu pa'i don to //

original: dbul po rnams kyis @268b mi rnyed pas //
analyzed: dbul po rnams kyis @268b mi rnyed pas //

analyzed: zhes pa ni rdzas de rnams kyi bum pa'i nang dag tu'o //

original: yang na lan grangs brgya rtsa brgyad //
analyzed: yang na lan grangs brgya rtsa brgyad //

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //

original: thun mtshams su'am /
analyzed: thun mtshams su'am /

analyzed: bum pa re re la grangs 'di tsam re re bya'o //

analyzed: rgyal po zhes bya ba'i rigs bye brag tu shes par bya'o //

analyzed: rtag tu zhes pa ni /

analyzed: dus thams cad du'am /

analyzed: nyin dang mtshan thams cad du'o //

original: rigs byin po gsum la yang bya'o //

analyzed: de ni gtso bo tsam smos pa yin te / de bden thams cad bde par 'gyur //

analyzed: de'i phyir / gtso bo tsam smos so zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: des ni rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa'i don ma lus par rgyas par bshad pa'o //

analyzed: de ring bdag gis dge ba gang zhig thob 'gyur ba //

analyzed: zla 'od gsal dang mu tig do shal dri med dkar po 'dra ba des //

analyzed: 'di ye shes rdo rjes smras pas sems can rnams kyis nyon /
